characters: ANGIER IS STILL STANDING BENEATH IT.
LARGE GLASS TANKS. DOZENS OF THEM. ROW AFTER ROW STRECHIN
INT. DINING ROOM, CLIFF HOUSE INN, COLORADO SPRING
ALFRED BORDEN REMOVES THE BOWLER HAT AND TAKES A BOW.
ANGIER HURLS HIMSELF INTO THE LIGHT.
FLOATING IN BACH AND EVERY TANK, DRESSED IN ROTTING STAGE
SHE SCREAMS- BIRD BLOOD SPLATTERS ONTO THE THREE OF THEN-
DEMONSTRATE THE ORIGINAL TRANSPORTED MAN- ACCEPT NO CHEAP
LETTERS ON A PAGE. IN MEANINGLESS COMBINATIONS. GIBBERISH
THE DOOR TO THE SECOND CABINET OPENS AND BORDEN STEPS OUT
ALLEY, GET OUT HERE AND LET ME IN
FALLON IS REALLY BORDEN IN DISGUISE.
HALF COLLAPSES ON THE DOVE AND THE ELEGANT LADY'S FINGERS
ANGIER IS STANDING DIRECTLY BEHIND HIM.
SEE, FOR THE FIRST TIME, SOMETHING FAMILIAR IN HIS FACE -
CLOTHES, IS YET ANOTHER ROBERT ANGIER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TOP HATS. Clustered in a small glade. As we SUPER TITLES, a BLACK CAT slinks its way through them. As TITLES END-

dialogues.speaker: BORDEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Are you watching closely? A SECOND BLACK CAT races into frame, HISSING, SPITTING, CHASING the first cat into the woods beyond and we-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moving along a row of CANARIES in CAGES.

dialogues.speaker: CUTTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Every magic trick consists of three part, or acts... Stop at a cage. Weathered HANDS envelope the canary. Hand and voice belongs to a man in his 60's- CUTTER.

dialogues.speaker: CUTTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The first part is called the Pledge... A LITTLE GIRL pershes on a chest in the workshop, watchin

dialogues.speaker: CUTTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ...the magician shows you something

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cutter moves to a small ORNATE CAGE resting on a prop tab

dialogues.speaker: CUTTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: A deck of cards, ar a bird...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A packed house. Many hands raised. Move in on a BEARDED M his gloved hand tentatively rising into the air.

dialogues.speaker: CUTTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ...or a man. A GLAMOROUS ASSISTANT beckons Bearded Man from the aisle. shuffles along his row towards her. Embarrassed.

dialogues.speaker: CUTTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: He show you this object, and pledges to you its utter normality... Bearbed Man and four other VOLUNTEERS follow the Assistan down towards the stage... 2.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On which stands the magician, leaning on his cane, smilin This is ROBERT ANGIER, 35, an American. Looming over him a large and complex ELETRICAL MACHINE.

dialogues.speaker: CUTTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Perhaps he asks you to inspect it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bearbed Man, FASCINATED, and other Volunteers look over the vast machine. As angier GESTURES theatrically at the various features of the metal and glass apparatus.

dialogues.speaker: CUTTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ...to see that it is indeed real...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the Assistant leads the Volunteers off the stage, Bear Man slips through the gap at the side of the curtains-

dialogues.speaker: CUTTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ...unaltered...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -looks around, DISORIENTED, then darts for some stairs le below stage where he runs into a burly STAGEHAND.

dialogues.speaker: CUTTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ...normal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd you think you're going?!

dialogues.speaker: CUTTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: But, of course, it probably isn't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bearded Man pulls off his beard, revealing the face of AL BORDEN, mid 30's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm part of the act, you fool!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Stagehand raises his eyebrows and steps aside. Borden RACES down below the stage. Cutter approaches the Stageha

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the machine GROANS to life. SPARKING and CRACKLING, An gazes at it, forgettig his audience. Entranced. Possessed

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden fumbles through the darkned area, lit by flashes a sparks through gaps in the boards of the stage above. He GASPS as a flash illuminates a STAGEHAND with SOLID WHITE EYES sitting nearby. Borden waves a hand in front of the 3.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cutter gently places the canary into the ornate cage.

dialogues.speaker: CUTTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The second act is called the Turn...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier, facing the audience, steps into the machine.

dialogues.speaker: CUTTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The magician takes the ordinary something...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden lights a MATCH. In front of him is a LARGE GLASS TANK FILLED WITH WATER, ITs LID PROPPED OPEN. Borden frow

dialogues.speaker: CUTTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ...and makes it do something extraordianry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cutter places a SILK SHAWL over the cage. Then SLAMS his hands down on the shawl, which FLATTENS- The Little Girl FLINCHES. Then STARES, FASCINATED.

dialogues.speaker: CUTTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Now you're looking for the secret.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bolts of electicity draw inwards, wrapping Angier in a ba of light which CRACKS-

dialogues.speaker: CUTTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: But you won't find it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ROOM fills with light as a TRAPDOOR snaps open and a BODY DROPS INTO THE TANK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because of course, you're not really looking...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lid of the tank and trapdoor above SNAP SHUT, leaving the tank, and Borden, in complete DARKNESS.

dialogues.speaker: CUTTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ...you don't really want to know. 4.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cutter WHIPS the shawl from the table. Cage and bird have DISAPPEARED.

dialogues.speaker: CUTTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ...you want to be fooled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Little Girl stares, EXPECTANT.

dialogues.speaker: CUTTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: But you couldn't clap yet. Because making something disappear isn't enough... you have to bring it back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MACHINE sputters to a stop. Angier is GONE. The audie sits, WAITING.

dialogues.speaker: CUTTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: That's why every magic trick has a third act. The hardest part..,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cutter forms a fist. Drapes the shawl over it.

dialogues.speaker: CUTTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ...the part we call...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cutter WHIPS the shawl away to reveal- the CANARY. The Little Girl CLAPS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden LIGHTS another match. Stares in HORROR-

dialogues.speaker: CUTTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ...The Prestige.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside the tank, ANGIER IS DROWNING. His rolling EYES fix on BORDEN, he POUNDS desperately on the thick glass, SCRE BUBBLES... The screen fades to BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: PROSECUTOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The Prestige...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PROSECUTOR turns to face the witness in the box: Cutt

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And did Robert Angier, the Great Danton, your employer, get to that final part of his trick that night? 5.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, sir. Something went wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What went wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw a someone head below the stage... I followed... and I found

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cutter points at the dock: Borden is there, CHAINED TO TH FLOOR. FLANKED BY GUARDS. Cutter POINTS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -watching Mr. Angier drown in a tank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you describe your occupation to the jury please, Mr.Cutter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm an ingeneur. I design illusions and construct the apparatus necessary for perfoming them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And for how long had you been Mr.Angier's "ingeneur"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eight years. I was privvy to the secrets of his entire act.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, Mr.Cutter, was this water-filled tank beneath the stage part of Mr.Angier's illusion- the illusion billed as "THE REAL TRANSPORTED MAN"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, sir. The tank had been used for the first trick, then taken offstage. Borden must have put it under the trap door after the interval.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cutter looks across at Borden, who is absently tapping hi hand against the rail- it is MUTILATED, MISSING 2 1/2 FIN The DEFENDER STANDS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How large was this tank?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sort of tank used for underwater escapes- four or five hundred gallons. 6.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you think Mr.Borden was able to move the tank under the trap door without anyone noticing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ask him- he's the magician.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Titters from the gallery. The Defenser turns to the JUDGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ask again that this man explain the mechanics of Mr.Angier's illusion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I reveal my magician's secrets here in open court, I'll be unemployable and the secrets will be worthless. The Real Transported Man is the most sought-after illusion in the business and I have te right to sell it on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Judge considers this. He looks at Cutter. Sympathetic

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr.Cutter, I see your predicament but we are talking about a capital offence- Alfred Borden's life hangs in the balance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cutter looks down. Quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you were prepared to disclose the details to me in private, I might be able to judge their relevance to the case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Might this be an acceptable compromisse?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amid murmurs of assent, the Judge ADJOURNS the proceeding

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the Guards begin the complex ritual of unlocking Borde chainsa from the floor, Borden's looks across the courtro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The LITTLE GIRL from the opening stands in the gallery, looking back at him. Borden gives her a little WAVE. She waves back, then is GUIDED OUT by a man wearing GLOVES an BOWLER HAT- this is FALLON. He nods at Borden. 7.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OWENS, 50's a lawyer, stands at the entry gate. The CAPTA of the guard walks out to greet him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to have to ask you to turn out your pockets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Owens raises his eyebrows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not my idea, sir. The Warden saw his show in Manchester last year where he vanished into thin air- he's convinced he'll try an escape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Owens smiles as he hands over his pocket watch ans wallet They walk along a hall wrought iron fence. The PRISON loo over them. A door in the prison opens and Borden emerges, trussed absurdly in chains held by two WARDERS. The other INMATES begin cattle-calling and whistling as BOrden is paraded u to a WOODEN SECTION of the fence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told him the only way Borden's going to disappear is if I leave him out with the others immates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the fence, the Warders lock the ends of their chains t thick eye hook set into the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check the locks. Twice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They check the locks. Then retreat to allow privacy. The Captain marches away. Borden looks at Owens. Bored.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name is Owens- I'm a solicitor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I represent Lord Caldlow, and accomplished amateur magician and historian of magic-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lord Caldlow is interested in- 8.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much for my tricks?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five thousand pounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talk to Fallon, my ingenuer- the money's for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did. He offered to sell all of your tricks... except the most valuable one - The Transported Man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd never forgive myself for selling my greatest trick. Borden signals the Wardens to come and unlock him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even for your daughter? Borden looks up. Owens moves closer, quietly assertive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If the newspapers are right, and you're for the drop, your daughter's going to need looking after

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fallon can take care of-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernard Fallon? A man with a past even more obscure than your own? The court have already motioned to have the girl removed from his "care". No, the girl is to be an orphan. I've been to the work house... Owens looks around the prison yard. Shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's better than this. Borden looks at Owens, hard. The Warders unlock Borden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm offering you a way to warp up your affairs with dignity, and I'm offering your daughter a future. As Lord Caldlow's ward she will want for nothing. Ever. (hands him a card) Think it over. 9.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden absently VANISHES the card as a REFLEX.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lord Caldlow wanted you to have this- (produces a leather

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As a show of good faith. He thought it might be of interest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SULLEN WALDER TALKS the journal, flicks through it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert Angier's diary... It includes the time he spent in Colorado learning your trick...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sullen hands the journal to Borden. Borden takes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier never learned my trick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? When he returned from Colorado he mounted a version of the Transported Man that the papers said was better, even...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Than your original.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you want Angier's secret you can dig him up and ask him for yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden TURNS, dragging the Warders with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want your secret, Mr.Borden...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Consider your daughter!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden, on the bed, opens Angier's JOURNAL. Starts to rea

dialogues.speaker: ANGIER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: A cypher. An enigma...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aniger, with a SIGH, closes a CARDBOARD-COVERED NOTEBOOK. OPENS his LEATHER-BOUND JOURNAL. Starts to write. 10.

dialogues.speaker: ANGIER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ...Borden's cypher is simple- unraveled by a single word. Now it takes only patience. And a passion to know his mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier lloks up at his own reflection in the train window

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No platform, no office, no sign. Just an electric streetl which, as Angier watches, FLICKERS ON. Angier, leaning heavily on his cane limps over to the light and stares up it as he's never seen one before.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Mr.Angier? Welcome to Colorado Springs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier looks back and smiles. A driver is looking down expectantly from atop a STAGECOACH. Angier hands his cane up to the driver nd , with some difficulty, hitches his w up to the roof of the rig. As he does, the town of Colora Springs rises into view, a few hundred yards down the roa lit brightly with ELECTRIC STREETLIGHTS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The whole town has electricity?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The driver nods and WHIPS the horses into action.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Stagecoach flies along, inches from a precipitious dr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It rounds a corner and pulls to a halt in front of the CL HOUSE INN, equal parts log cabin and crystal palace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lobby is cavernous and immaculate. The entire STAFF o the hotel - BELLBOYS, MAIDS, COOKS, and GARDENERS - are l up along the sides like a regiment of soldiers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier reaches the reception desk and the smiling MANAGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quit a reception.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're our first guest of the season, Mr.Angier. (opens guest book) Your telegram didn't indicate how long you would be staying with us. 11.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As long as it takes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll need a coach tomorrow to take me up the mountain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The peak is closed, sit. For scientific experimentation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why I'm here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A stagecoach rumbles along a dirt track, The driver pulls on his reigns and the coach pulls to a stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to walk the reat, I'm afraid, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier nods. Lowers himself down to the roadway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier comes through the trees to find a wire fence with sign: EXTREME DANGER- NO TRESPASSING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beyond the fence is a COMPOUND of three BARNS. Rising fro the center barn is a 200ft steel TOWER capped with a GIAN STEEL BALL. GIANT ARCING BOLTS of electricity run down th tower from the ball. The windows of the building RADIATH with BLUE EXPLOSIONS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier stops forwards, entranced, and threads his fingers through the fence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is sent FLYING backwards -- the fence has been electri

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tower is SHUT OFF- a door opens and a stout little MA shotgun under one arm, MARCHES up to the fence. He uses a RUBBER PAD to pry open the fence and stands over Angier, is CURLED on the ground, GROWNLING in pain, trying to sta

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm amazed at how many of you newspaper writers can't read mu sign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shotgun picks up Angier's cane and hands it to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not the welcome I was expecting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shotgun RECOGNIZES Angier, AMAZED. 12.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you. You're that magician-the Great Danton. (helps Angier up) I'm Alley. I saw your show. IN London. Seven times- you guessed every object the audience had in their pockets. Angier leans on his cane and gently brushes off the dirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry about the fence. People keep interfering with our work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've come to see Tesla.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He built a machine for a- for a colleague of mine. A long time ago. Can you get me a meeting with him? (off his look) I've come a very long way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Impossible, I'm afraid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've brought a lot of money. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Mr.Angier. I simply can't help you. Alley pulls the fence closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be staying at the hotel. Indefinitely. Alley watches Angier walk away. He pulls something from h pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What am I holding? Angier doesn't look back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alley GRINS, opening his hand. He is holding a gold watch 13.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier sits, the cardboard-bound notebook on the table in front of him. He makes a notations in his own journal as deciphers Borden's words.

dialogues.speaker: ANGIER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: April 3rd, 1893... a few days after he first met me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier runs his finger along the first line, translating.

dialogues.speaker: BORDEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: We were too young men at the start of a great career...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden sits in the audience. Younger- both hands intact.

dialogues.speaker: BORDEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Two young man devoted to an illusion...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two rows in front sits Angier. Similarly youthful.

dialogues.speaker: BORDEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Two young men who never intended to hurt anyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Onstage is a TANK. Standing beside the tank is a beautifu young magician's assistant. JULIA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The magician, MILTOn, adress the audience.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which of you brave souls is willing to bind this lovely young woman...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milton GESTURES to Julia- the MEN in the crowd go wild- h in the air, catcalls. Smiling radiantly, Julia selects tw young men, who SCRAMBLE up to the stage- ANGIER and BORDE younger, full of energy- Angier has no limp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They spring onto stage, beside Julia and take the ROPE sh offers them. Milton GRABS a HOOK that descends from the flies on a chain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cutter is watching fron the wings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are either of you two gentlemen gailors?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both shakes their hands as they start to bind Julia with ropes, Borden wrapping the rope around her wrists, Angier the one around her ankles. 14.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm sure you can both tie a strong knot...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Borden finishes his knot tests it, it SLIPS APART. Borden frowns, hastly RETYING it, covering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cutter NOTICES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden finishes, glancing at julia who gives a small sign assent with her eyes. As Angier finishes tying her ankles he sneaks a light KISS on her ankle. She frowns at him an raises her arms. Milton hooks the rope onto the chain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milton gesticulates in the wings, Cutter signals to a stagehand who starts HOISTING Julia into the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milton wheels the tank under Julia's bare feet. Cutter fe for the handle of an AXE placed by his feet and pulls out STOPWATCH. JULIA looks down at Angier. They smile at each other. Jul DROPS into the tank with a massive splash- Milton SLAMS t lid shut, PADLOCKS it and raises a curtain around the tan

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cutter checks his stopwatch, grips the handle of the axe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A grand GESTURE from Milton- the curtain around the tank DROPS- Julia is GONE. Milton raises the curtain again, th with another flourish, DROPS it to reveal JULIA, beside t tank, one arm in the air, dripping wet, smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The audience erupts in APPLAUSE. Angier smiles produly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier, Borden and Julia sit around the cluttered room. Borden is in the middle of a passionate rant-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milton's squadering their goodwill or a bunch of tired second-hand tricks-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Old favourites, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about something fresh? He won't even try a bullet catch-

dialogues.speaker: CUTTER, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Bullet catch is suicide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They turn. Cutter stands in the doorway, counting out mon 15.

dialogues.speaker: CUTTER, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: All it takes is a smart-arse volunteer dropping a button down the barrel...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can't use plants for every trick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There'd be no seats left for the punters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine- no bullet catch. But a real magician tries to invent something new, something other magicians scratch their heads over-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They sells it to them for a small fortune.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cutter hands Angier some money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I suposse you have such a trick, Mr.Borden?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Care to sell it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one else could do my trick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't even know what it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Show it to me twice, I'll do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cutter looks at Borden, thoughtful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I admire your spirit, Mr.Angier. But if Borden here really has invented his masterpiece it might well be something only he can do. 16.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It might be something only he is prepared to do. (gestures to the props) my illusions employer, Mr.Milton, is a skilled showman. But Borden's right- he won't get his hands dirty. You want to see what it takes to make real magic- go to the Tenley. There's a Chinaman there who's got what it takes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chung Ling Soo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tickets are pricey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know a lad on the door. You two watch his show- whoever tells me how he does his goldfish bowl trick gets the prize.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cutter gives a sly smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten minutes onstage in front of my old friend, Mr.Ackerman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier and Borden prick up at the name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's Ackerman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The most powerful theatrical agent in London.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cutter holds out money to Borden, who reaches for it- Cut grabs his wrist. Serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw you drop the knot again, Borden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I had my wrist turned- 17.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some nights you just can't get it, can you? If that knot slips when Julia's on the hoist she'll break a leg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the wrong knot. A Langford double would hold tighter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Langford double's not a wet knot it's too dangerous. The ropes could swell and she'd never slip it-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can slip a Lanford underwater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've been practiced it-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julia glances at Angier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No more mistakes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden stares at Cutter. Leaves. Angier watches him go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's he from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier nods. Fair enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shuffles props for Virgil at the Hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He works for another magician? Aren't you worried he'll steal your tricks?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't deal in methods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know? 18.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I hired him to try and find out Virgil's orange trick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know if I trust him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a natural magician. Of course you can't trust him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think he's alright. Angier turns to Julia. Smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think everyone's alright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even you. Julia kisses Angier. Cutter rises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Mr.Angier...? (Angier looks up) Learn your aight lines- if I can see you sneaking a peck on your wife's ankle from the wings, the blokes on each end of rows 3 and 4 can, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden watches from the wings. Onstage, a magician, Virgi locks a CANARY into a cage then covers the cage with a SH Borden notices a beautiful YOUNG WOMAN in the front row w a little BOY who is watching Virgil's act, spellbound. Virgil SLAMS the SHAWL down onto the table, as if nothing were beneath it, then WHIPS it away- BIRD and CAGE are go The little BOY begins to WAIL and CRY. Borden watches as the young woman tries to make him stop. Virgil takes the flower from his lapel, covers it with th shawl, and SNAPS it away- the flower has become the CANAR The audience bursts into enthusiastic APPLAUSE, but the l boy is still CRYING INCONSOLABLY. Virgil takes bows and walks off, handing Borden the canary as he passes backsta As the audience leaves, Borden climbs off the stage and h the bird in front of the boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look- he's all right. He's fine. 19.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But where's his brother? Borden is at a loss. He turns to the young woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sharp lad, your son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My brother. Borden smiles back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden gently strokes the bird's feathered head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the lucky one tonight. Borden walks to a wall of DOZENS of bird cages -- each on with an identical canary. He puts the bird into its cage and returns to the cart props. He taps on the top of the TABLE- a panel POPS open, revealing the FLATTENDED BIRD C Borden insefts a ROD into the bird cage and PRIES it apar A TRICKLE of BLOOD emerges, dripping into a bucket below. Borden SLAPS the cage. And the FLATTENED CARCASS of the ORIGINAL BIRD slides out and SPLASHES into the bucket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden exits. The young woman, SARAH, is there with her brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the brother) Are you watching closely? Borden reaches to the Boy's ear. Casually produces a coin The Boy marvels as he takes the coin then looks at Borden

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's got two heads. Sarah smiles. Borden crouches to address the Boy, grave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never. Show. Anyone. 20.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Boy looks at him, a little afraid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'll beg you and flatter you for the secret- but as soon as you give it up you'll be nothing to them. Understand? Nothing. The secret impresses no one- the trick you use it for is everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden looks into the boy's staring eyes. Then SMILES and pets him on the head. he stands. Sarah smiles at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where do you two live?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lives with Mum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah lingers at the top of the stairs to her flat. Borde tries to KISS her, but she pushes him back. He tests the LOCK of the open door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enough to keep me out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think so. Wil I see you again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden SHRUGS and turns to go back down the stairs. Sarah looks after him, about to change her min. Hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She closes the door and LOCKS it, smiling. After a moment she pads through living/kitchen area, draws back the curt to her bedroom and SHRIEKS:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden is there, smiling. Sarah moves towards him, giggli

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Onstage, CHUNG LING SOO, 60's, wearing a long silk robe, HOBBLES painfully to the center of the stage. Clearly CRIPPLED. In the audience, Borden and Angier watch intent

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soo lays a silk SHAWL and a BARE TABLE. He WHIPS it up, revealing a BOUQUET OF ROSES. So repeats the trick again and again, producing a different object each time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally, with a drum roll, Soo whips the shawl aside to r a MASSIVE GOLDFISH BOWL, complete with GOLDFISH. 21.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To THUNDEROUS APPLAUSE, Soo bows and HOBBLES off the stag Angier, clapping, shakes his head, utterly baffled. He tu to Borden. Who has a small, knowing, smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden and Angier watch Soo being helped down from his carriege by HANDLERS who treat him with great gentleness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're wrong. It can't be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is. He carries the bowl between his knees for the entire performance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: but look at the man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the trick. This is why no one detectes his method.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soo hobbles into the restaurant, frail, and fragile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Total devotion to his art... (looks at Angier) Utter self-sacrifice. It's the only way to escape this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden SLAPS the bricks of the wall behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julia, in bed, watches Angier, SHEET wrapped around him l a robe, HOBBLING. He pulls up the sheeyt- between his kne is a goldfish bowl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can barely lift this thing and it's not even filled with water. Or fish. He must be strong as an ox.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's been preteding to be an cripple for years?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any time he's in public. Any time he goes out. It's unthinkable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier puts the bowl down with a flourish. Climbs into be 22.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden saw it at once. I couldn't fathom it- living your whole life pretending to be someone else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're pretending to be someone else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think changing your name compares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not just your name- who you are, where you're from...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I promised my family I wouldn't embarrass them with my theatrical endeavors. Angier cuddles up to Julia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I came up with a name for you... "The Great Danton"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't like it? It's sophisticated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's French.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah unlocks the door, but has to PUSH against MAGICAL P stacked against it- the bedsit is FILLED with DEVICES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alfred?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah surveys the confusion- spots Borden across the flat deep in conversation with another man. Borden spots her-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have our routine for Ackerman!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other man turns- it is Fallon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We haven't had the pleasure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fallon nods. Borden comes over, holding a DUELING PISTOL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr.Fallon is my ingeneur- 23.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did yo get all of-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Begged, borrowed and don't ask. Mr.Fallon's an enterprising soul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fallon slips past Sarah with a nod to Borden. Exits. Sara looks at Borden. TENSE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't afford to pay him-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll start making money once we have our audience-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And until then? What I earn is barely enough for us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll give him half of my food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah looks meaningfully at Borden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're already going to be sharing it with someone else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden looks at her, confused. Then realizes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Having a baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden freezes. Then SMILES, taking her in his arms. She FLINCHES against the gun he is holding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The trick to wake up Ackerman at the end of my audition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your great trick? The "masterpiece that will make our fortunes"? 24.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. The world isn't ready for that one, yet. Borden moves to the bureau and starts LOADING the gun. Pouring in SHOT, then WADDING...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is merely a run-of-the-mill daring and spectacular bullet catch- Borden drops the BULLET into the barrel...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not letting you get shot. Borden RAMS the bullet and charge down then removes the R and hands the pistol to Sarah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's perfectly safe. Shoot me. Sarah looks at Borden then down at the pistol. She aims a Borden. Then sims off, at a mirror beside him. BANG. Borden's hand SNAPS out to "catch" the bullet. The mirror is intact. Borden looks at Sarah, grave, as he reveals the bullet in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Show me. (Borden shakes head) Then you're not doing it. I can't raise a child on my own, Alfred. Borden looks at her. Takes the bullet from her and places it on the bureau.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bullet goes in the gun. Then comes the ramrod. He takes the RAMROD and PUSHES it down onto the bullet, w disappears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He points the ramrod at Sarah- she pulls the bullet out o the HOLLOW TIP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The buller's not even in the gun when the charge is fired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah looks at ramrod with disdain. 25.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once you know it's so obvious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden BRISTLES slightly. Takes the bullet back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, well, people still get killed perfoming it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sme smart-arse drops something down the barrel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Such as?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A penny, or a button. Or, of course, a bullet. (off worried look) But don't fret-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden embraces her, putting his hand on her belly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not letting anything happen- I love you too much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah grabs his face, looking at his eyes, smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say it again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope. Not today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some days, it's not true. Todayt you don't mean it. Maybe today you're more in love with magic than me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's alright. I like being able to tell the difference- it makes the days it is true mean something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden shakes his head, grinning. 26.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier closes Borden's notebook. He looks across at a photograph of julia on the table. Reaches for his own dia

dialogues.speaker: ANGIER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Borden writes as if no one but he understood the true nature of magic...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden sits on his cot reading Angier's journal.

dialogues.speaker: ANGIER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ...but what does he know of self- sacrifice more than the rest of us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden looks up from Angier's journal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bloody fool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden TOSSES the book across the cell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A POLICEMAN opens the door for the Judge and Cutter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all laid out down the end, you honour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Judge NODS. The Policeman exits, LOCKING them inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Judge follows Cutter, approaching a collection of mag apparatus, including a MASSIVE CRATE. Cutter looks up at with AWE, touching the side where it says "COLORADO SPRIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's in there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cutter OPENS it, revealing metal and glass MACHINERY with

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier's machine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You built this, Mr.Cutter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no. This wasn't built by a magician... it was built by a wizard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A man who can actually do the things a magician pretends to... 27.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cutter closes the crats. The JUDGE turns to other props.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: your honour, what will happen to these things when the trial is over?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Judge is staring at a large glass tank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've benn sold to a Lord Caldlo. An avid collector, apparently very interested in the case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't let him take this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Judge looks over. Cutter is touching the crate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why ever not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's dangerous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure beneath its bells and whistles it's get some simple and disappointing trick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The most disappointing of all- it has no trick. It's real.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Judge looks at Cutter. Smiles indulgently. Turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the tank Angier drowned in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cutter turns to look at the empty, smashed glass of the t Nods. Cutter indicates the top of the tank, where there i a PADLOCK. Cutter pushes down on a panel of the lid-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This lets the performer's hands reach the trick padlock...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -a small section POPS open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A standard magical apparatus for escapes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With one important difference...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cutter grabs the PADLOCK. Rattles it. 28.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't a trick lock... it's been switched out for a real one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Judge stares at the tank, appaled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a way to kill someone. Why in God's name go to such lengths?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These are magicians, you honour. Showmen. Men who live by dressing up plain and sometimes brutal truths to amaze. To shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even without and audience?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cutter stares at the tank- INSERT CUT: ANGIER SCREAMING BUBBLES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was and audience. (looks at Judge) See, the water tank had a particular signinficance for the two men...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Onstage, A SIMILAR TANK FILLED WITH WATER.

dialogues.speaker: CUTTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: A particular awful significance...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julia stands next to the tank. Milton adresses the audien

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which of you brave souls is willing bind this lovely young woman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milton gestures to Julia- the crowd goes wild. Julia make a show of deciding. She picks up Angier and Borden, who a made up to look different from the last performance. As they leap up onto stage, Borden makes eye contact with Cu in the wings- Cutter's is a WARNING GLANCE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Angier ties Julia's ankles he can't resist tickling ju under her toes- she KICKS him in the chin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden starts to wrap the rope around Julia's wrists in a particular fashion. Stops. Reconsiders. Julia NODS at him, encouring. Borden starts RETRYING the knot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cutter watches. His hand checking for the axe handle. 29.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden tests the rope- it is tight. Julia gives him the sign with her eyes- he steps back. Angier rises to his fe grinning at Julia. As she raises her arms to the hook, sh can't quite hide her smile back at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milton gives the sign and Julia is HOISTED into the air. Cutter slips his STOPWATCH out of his pocket as Milton mo the tank under Julia's bare feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier looks up at Julia. Proud. She stares out over the audience, preparing herself. Looks down at Angier, smilin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julia PLUNGES into the tank- Milton SLAMS the lid shut- C checks his stopwatch, hand caressing the axe handle...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milton raises the curtain around the tank, then circles i working his "magic". Angier shifts a little. Time passing Milton looks at Cutter- TOO MUCH TIME...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cutter GRASPS his axe and SPRINT at the tank- Milton RIPS the curtain down- Julia, one arm free, is CONVULSING...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier and Borden look on in HORROR as Cutter SWINGS his into the glass- which CRACKS... cutter SWINGS again and a the web of crackes GROWING, Julia's convulsions SLOWING, eyes PLEADING with Angier's, until-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRASH- the glass gives way, FLOODING the stage- Cutter an Angier GRASP at Julia- FULL her onto the stage- Cutter EL Angier out of the way to POUND on Julia's chest- Borden wacthes, stunned, as Julia FLOPS, LIFELESS, onto the boar Cutter looks up at Angier, stricken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier takes Julia in his arms, looking down at her stari eyes. He desperately BRUSHES water from Julias cheeks and forehead. Borden looks on, shen.

dialogues.speaker: BORDEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: How often I've fought with my self over that night .. one half of me swearing bling that i tied a simple slip knot... the other half convinced that I tied the Langford double. I suppose I'll never know for sure-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier looks up from Borden's journal, despairing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can be not know?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier FLINGS Borden's journal across the room.

dialogues.speaker: ANGIER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: He must know what he did. He must. 30.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden smiles as he reads Angier's dairy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "How can be not know?!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because, Angier, life is complicated, people are complicated, knots are

dialogues.speaker: PRISONER, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Shit it, Professor, or I'll shut it for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden quiets. Looking at the journal.

dialogues.speaker: BORDEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: How could I not know? How can you read my story and not understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cutter sits in the CROWDED GALLERY. Borden, in the dock, SCANS the crowd. Finally SPOTS Fallon pushing to the fron he is alone. Borden stares at him. Fallon shakes his dead

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden is prompted to stand by two GUARDS as the Judge en The JUDGE has a piece of black cloth draped over his wig.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alfred Borden, you have been found guilty of the murder of Robert Angier. You will, in one month's time, be hanged by the neck until dead. May the Lord have mercy on your soul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden barely reacts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden stands at the fence with Fallon

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They took her away?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To the workhouse?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another slow nod. Borden closes his eyes with despair. Th opens them and hands Fallon OWENS' CARD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell him I've reconsidered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's for the best. 31.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier stares down at the NOTEBOOK, making notes on a nap Through large windows a THUNDERSTORM batters Pike's Peak. Angier is the only guest in the hotel's massive dining ro

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Mind if I join you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier looks around. Alley is standing by the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tesla sends me down here during the storms. Perfect excuse to come shere a drink with the Great Danton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alley sits, gesturing to a waiter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you tried our Bourbon yet, Mr. Angier? It matches the scenery nicely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two of 'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beautiful, isn't it? I do miss New York, though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lightning lives here. And noit much else- our work is secret.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alley glances down at the notebook and Agier's scribbles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cypher?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier nods as Alley lifts the cardboard notebook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My profession also deals in secrets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alley looks at the gibberish on the pages of the notebook

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a rotating transposition that shifts every day of the dairy. Simple but time-consuming to translate once you have the five-letter keyword.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier smiles as he reaches for the notebook. 32.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We magicians have a circle of trust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have a circle of trust with someone whose dairy you stole?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I bought it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Magicians sell their secrets?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's how we pay for our retirements and how greats tricks outlive us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alley considers this. Taps the cover of the notebook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're hoping to find a great secretin there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've already found it. That's why I'm here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier reaches in his pocket and removes his own, leather bound journal. He tears a PAGE from it and hands it to Al Who unfolds it ans stares at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tesla built one for another magician.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would you want the same thing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call it a professional rivalry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tesla has built unusual machines for unusual people, but he would never talk about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand discretion. I just want the machine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alley looks at Angier. Thinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finish your drink. You'll have a special appreciation for our work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought it was a secret. 33.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a magician. Who's going to believe you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The storm has abated. Angier's cane into the muddy ground as he follows Alley through the moonlit field.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are large glass GLOBES pushing out of the soil as i planted all around them. They stop in the middle of the field, looking down at the electric LIGHTS of the town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We do our tests when the townspeople are asleep- Mr.Tesla doesn't want to scare anyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alley checks his wacth by the moonlight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not long now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they watch, the lights of Colorado Springs DISAPPEAR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our equipment requires a great deal of current. Tesla eletrified the whole town in exchange for using the generators when we need to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The field around them EXPLODES with DAZZLING LIGHT. Angie laughs out in surprise- the field is full of a thousand l LIGHTBULBS, all glowing together. Alley bends down and pi up the nearest lightbulb -- as he does, the light in it extinguises. He tosses the bulb to Angier. Except for the size, it's a normal lightbulb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are the wires?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier bends and gently PUSHES the lightbulb into a rando spot in the wet soil. The lightbulb FLICKERS on again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the generator?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You saw it last week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But that must be ten miles from here. 34.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifteen. And I have to ride all of them before I get to bed. (turns to leave) I'll send word for you in a few days, Mr.Angier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier bends to pick up his lightbulb. As he does, the li FADES in all of them, and the lights in town come back on Angier is alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier has his head SUBMERGED in a sink full of water. He BURSTS FREE, GASPING- COLLA`PSES to the floor, SOBBING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier lays out MAKE-UP SUPPLIES. He takes out a BULLE. Places it on the sink next to a FALSE MOUNSTAGE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rough. Unwelcoming. Crowded. A small "stage" at one end: Borden works his way through the Chinese rings. The crowd is JEERING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out your gun, Professor!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone BURLS a bottle at the stage- it narrowly misses. Borden GLARES out into the audience. Pulls out his GUN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A volunteer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd SURGES forward with EAGER VOLUNTEERS. Fallon sc the crowd, passing over too-eager and too-drunk before settling on a MOUNSTACHED MAN and bringing him up onstage

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden LOADS the pistol, hands it to Moustache and steps backwards, pulling his coat apart, CHALLENGING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you man enought, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something in Moustache's tone makes Borden looks closely- behind the moustache... Angier. QUIVERING WITH TENSION. 35.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden looks at the trembling gun. Then at Angier. Spread his hands, inviting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier purses his lips, straining to pull the trigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier's eyes are almost closed as he SQUEEZES the TRIGGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fallon HITS Angier JUMPS to Borden's side, GRABBING his BLEEDING HAND. The DROWS is SCREAMING, PUSHING for the do os STRAINING for a closer look at Borden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aniger, SHOCKED, melts into the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier sits at the bar. Staring. He raises his pint glass Downs it, then STOPS, looking at the bottom- there is a PLAYING CARD. He loos around. Cutter is sitting at a tabl with two fresh pints in front of him. Angier heads over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never thought I'd find an answer at the bottom of a pint glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hasn't stopped you looking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard about a booking. Nice little theatre. Good up-and-coming magician.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got me a booking? Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cutter looks down into his beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I want to keep working... (looks up at Angier) And who's going to hire the ingeneur who killed Julia McCullough in front of a sellout crowd at the Orpheum?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier looks back at Cutter. 36.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone who know that it wasn't your fault. Someone who knows Alfred Borden and his repertoire of exotic knots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heard he had a spot of bad luck doing a bullet catch South of the river.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier looks down at the liquid in his glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To die like that. Locked in water... lungs screaming...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did she go through, Cutter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cutter watches Angier's distress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew an old sailor. Told me about a time he got pulled over the side tangled in the sheets... they dragged him out, but it was five minutes before he coughed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier stares at Cutter. Hanging.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said it was like... going home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier considers this. Collects himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which knot did Borden tie that night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wouldn't say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wouldn't say?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was as if... as if he didn't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier and Cutter isspect a large empty room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll have to whitewash the windows to cofound the more curious members of your audience...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But this should do. 37.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should see about an assistant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've made arrangements. Have you settled on a name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I have. The Great Danton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmm. Bit old-fashioned? Angier smiles gently at Cutter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. It's sophisticated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier is sitting at a worktable, pensive. He is moving o hand across the other, making a ROSE appear and disappear The windows have been WHITEWASHED and the room has filled with an array of magical apparati: cabinets, costumes, pr On the other side of the room Cutter watches as OLIVIA WENSCOMBE, 20s, equal parts grace and mischief, squeezes herself into a tall cabinet, looking past Cutter to Angie

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's so hard about this? Cutter leans into the cabinet and pops up a TRICK PANEl i the floor, revealing a tiny chamber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In here, Miss Wenscombe. No point meeting Mr.Angier unless you fit. Olivia shrugs and hands Cutter her hat, then her thick sk and folds herself into the bottom of the box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Breathe as little as possible. Cutter closes the lid over her and walks over to Angier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not much experience , but she knows the basics. She knows how to present herself and a pretty assistant's the most effective from of misdirection. Angier nods. There is a small SNEEZE from inside the cabi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I suppose I should let her out. 38.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah is frantcally REDRESSIN Borden's injured hand. BLOO has SEEPED trough the bandages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand, Alfred. How can it be bleeding again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She examines the wounds: 2 1/2 FINGERS ARE MISSING. The injuries are black, but wet and fresh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What have you been doing to it? It looks as had as the day it happened. We need to get the doctot back-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can' afford the doctor back! A BABY STARTS CRYING in the bedroom. Sarah glares at Bord

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've woken her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I just need this to heal so I can het back to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah looks at Borden. Reluctantly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alfred, you have to face things. What tricks could you peform with this kind of injury?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some of the card pulls, prop tricks... (leans forward, excited) And the trick I've been telling you about. The trick they'll remember me for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier and Cutter at the workbench, examine a BIRD CAGE. Cutter is wearing a strange LEATHER HARNESS over his shir it has LARGE SPRINGS and small PULLEYS on the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bird cage can't be our climax- everybody knows it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not like this, they don't. 39.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I don't want to kill doves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then stay off the stage. (glares at Angier) You're a magician, not a wizard- you have to get your hands dirty to achieve the impossible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sound like him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holds up cage) Put your hands on the sides...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A heavy, disinterested man slouches in the third row of t empty theatre with a newspaper- MERRIT, the stage manager Onstage, Angier energetically YANKS coloured handkerchief from a hat and TOSSING them into the air. Olivia, in the glamorous, revealing costume of Magician's Assistant, dar back and forth PLUCKING the handkerchiefs from the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier finishes with a flourish. Merrit shrugs. Angier places an ORNATE CAGE onto the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need a volunteer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merrit rolls his eyes. Climbs to his feet. Angier produce a DOVE. Places it in the cage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now Angier is wearing the harness. He places a dove in th cage and picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close on: HOOKS concealed on Angier's palm slip into CATC on the bars of the cage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang on, hang on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cutter reaches in and slips a NOOSE around the bird's ank

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There we go. Now you tell the volunteer to put his hands here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cutter pleases his hands on the TOP and BOTTOM of the cag 40.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merrit places his hands on the TOP and BOTTOM of the bird cage. Angier's hands are on the sides. Olivia reaches aro Merrit to place her hands on the remaining two sides. Mer looks up at Angier over his glasses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd beat not be intending to hut this animal, Mr.Angier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier raises and lowers their hands in a rythm...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And one, two... THREE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bird cage, and the dove, VANISH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier and Cutter have their hands on the bird cage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bird cage BREAKS APART, WHIPPING UP ANGIER'S FOREARMS WHERE SLEEVES WOULD BE, YANKED BY THE HARNESS. Angier smi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bloody marvelous, Cutter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the best part...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cutter reaches to Angier's armpit... pulls up the DOVE, HANGING BY ITS ANKLE, ALIVE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thought you said I had to get my hands dirty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someday, perhaps you will. I needed to know that you can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merrit nods, impressed, stepping backwards. Angier REACHE into Merrit's pocket. Removes a dove.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very nice. Very nice indeed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olivia packs up the props. Cutter approaches from the win 41.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't had a chance to compliment you on your beautiful theatre yet, Mr.Merrit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lot more beautiful when it's full, Mr.Angier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You all say that. Why sould I worry? If your tricks don't get 'em in, someone else's will. Maybe someone willing to do a bullet catch or a water scape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: cheap thrills, Mr.Merrit. People hoping for an accident- and quite likely to see one, too. What would that do for your business?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got a week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A line a PATRONS runs from the box office to the street. The marquee above the theatre reads: "THE GREAT DANTON PE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier is perfoming to a good crowd. He steps forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sir, in the hat. Could you show us your handkerchief?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MAN in the audience STANDS and pulls a HANDKERCHIEF fro his pocket. He stares at it, CONFUSED. The audience LAUGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps you'd be so good as to return it to the other man. He has yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another man stands and pulls out a handkerchief. APPLAUSE Angier dows and walks quickly off the stage, past the squ of DANCING GIRLS who run on to entertain in the break. 42.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cutter and Olivia are waiting for Angier as he comes off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so nervous- I'm sorry, I'm making mistakes. Cutter quickly REMOVES Angier's coat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The audience doesn't seem to be responding much, Cutter. Cutter puts he LEATHER HARNESS over Angier's arms...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a grand theatre with a sophisticated audience- They've seen most of these tricks before. But not this next one. You'll see. Cutter checks the SPRINGS of the harness and replaces Ang coat. He spots a STAGEHAND poking his head around the fli

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You! Piss off out it! The dancers are wrapping up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wish us luc, Cutter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll have the champagne ready. Angier, followed by Olivia, steps out onto the stage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier steps to the table center stage. Pulls out the bir cage. There are one or two groans from the audience. Angi SMILES as he produces a DOVE with a FLOURISH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've seen this one before?

dialogues.speaker: HECKLER, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Seen 'em all before, mate! Laughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'll make it a little harder, shall I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the wings, Cutter smiles and nods at Angier's showmans 43.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two volunteers, please. A lady and a gentleman to hold this cage with me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hands go up. Olivia pulls an ELEGANT LADY from the audien

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll perform this feat in a manner never before seen by yourselves or by any other audience anywhere in the worth...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olivi brings Elegant Lady onto the stage along with a RED BEARDED MAN. The audience is getting interested. Angier i on role...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any magician can make this cage disappear... that's why I'll ask this good lady and fine gentleman to place their hands firmly on the cage...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olivia guides Elegant Lady's hands onto the sides of the cage. Red-beard places a hand underneath the cage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...to ensure that no trickery whatsover is employed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier RAISES the bird cage. The audience is RAPT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red beard's other hand appears on the top of the cage- it MUTILATED, missing fingers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier FREEZES- looks up at Red Beard... IT IS BORDEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden SMILES as he WORMS his little finger into the cage mechanism...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden smiles at Angier through his blood-spattered fake beard and retreats into the chaos surrounding the Elefant Lady who is still SCREAMING as Angier tries to free her fingers from the mechanism.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier and Cutter watch the STAGEHANDS clear the stage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should've spotted him. 44.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You had a lot of plates spinning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier looks down at the harness in his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't suppose they'll let us do this one again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's the climax of our show?

dialogues.speaker: MERRIT, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Show? You don't have a show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr.Merrit, we have a week's engagment-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To perform magic- not butcher birds and break my costomer's fingers! Clear out, anything here in the morning gets burned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cutter puts his hand on Merrit's arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr.Merrit-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's done, John. I've hired a comedian. You know I hate comedians, which should indicate the may I felel about your friend's future as a stage magician.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cutter nods. Merrit leaves. Cutter turns to Angier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are plenty of good theatres... if we can come up with another trick and change the name of the act-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The name stays.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cutter sees Angier's resolve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. Well, the new trick will have to be irresistible, then. I've a couple of methods to try out, but we'll need a fresh angle on the presentation. 45.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you need inspiration, there's a technical exposition at the Albert Hall this week. Scientists and engineers. That sort of thing captures the popular imagination.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The large concert hall is surrounded by crowds and covere in banners advertising a Technical Exposition. Angier mak his way past a giant STEAM ENGINE and into the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THe lobby if filled with displays and models. Angiers pok around, looking thouroughly disinterested until he comes an information booth plastered with illustrations of electrical bolts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like to know the future, sir? The man who kill change the world is speaking right now. Continents divided no more. Free, clean power. The mysteries of the world solved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The posters show a tall, handsome man bathed in lightning and standing astride the world like colossus. In bold pri

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hall is completely darkened, but bright blue FLASHES illuminate ANGIER as he pushes his way to a seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the stage, a tall rod capped with a steel ball is transmitting a steady, sparking stream of electricity ont matched ball across the stage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FIGURE walks around from behind the machine and the aud GASPS as a shower of sparks bounce off of his immaculate evening wear. This is TESLA- but Angier is too far from t stage to get a good look at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a system like this I could have the entire city electrified whitin two years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The audience breaks into LAUGHTER. The spell is broken. Tesla must be a lunatic. 46.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Edison's direct current system is flawed and dangerous. With my alternating current devices-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone from the audience chimes in:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fraud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier turns to look. The man who called out is leaving he's not alone. Angier FREEZES, staring down at aisle-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden is sitting there, RAPT, lit by FLASHES from the machinery on stage. As tesla continues his demonstration, Angier STARES at Borden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden walks down the street. Angier is following him. Borden meets Sarah, pushing a PRAM. Borden looks down at the baby then up at Sarah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See? Today, it's true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier watches Borden kiss wife then his baby.

dialogues.speaker: ANGIER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I saw hapiness...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier writing in his leather-bound journal.

dialogues.speaker: ANGIER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ...hapiness that should have been mine. But I was wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier glances at Borden's notebook sitting on the desk.

dialogues.speaker: ANGIER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Reading his account I realize that he never had the life I envied.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier flips open the notebook. Staring at the coded writ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The family life he craves one minute he rails against the next, demanding freedom. His mind is a divided one... 47.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden sits on his cot. Reading Angier's journal.

dialogues.speaker: ANGIER, (V.O.)
