dialogues.text: His soul restless. His wife and child tormented by his fickle and contradictory nature...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden is crying. He puts the journal down and jumps to h feet BANGING on the cell door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guard! Guard!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The viewing slot slides open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do want, Professor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paper and pencil. Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Te library is long and titled, with two long tables. It looks as if it used to be a latrine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden sits at a table. Writing on a stack of notepaper. His arms have been unbound, but long chains runs from his ellbows to where Sullen Gaurd sits smoking, craning his n to read Borden's writing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me see?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sullen SNATCHES up the papers. Borden makes no move to st him. The top sheet is a sketch of a cabinet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to know all of the Professor's secrets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only if I teach you how to read.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sullen mashes the papers into a ball and drops them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just stupid tricks, right? Haven't helped you get out of here-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have they? Or can't you open real locks, Professor? 48.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps I'm just biding my time. Perhaps one day I'll just hold up my

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden produces a RUBBER BALL in front of Sullen's face. Sullen stares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -get you attention. Then quietly

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "are you wacthing closely"... perhaps say a magic word or two... then I'll be gone. Borden VANISHES the ball, but FUMBLES it, it drops to Bor feet. Sullebn LAUGHS as Borden SCRABBLEs around his ankle to retrieve the ball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you get so famous, then? Borden STANDS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Magic. Borden TURNS, NO LONGER CHAINED. Sullen JUMPS to his feet to follow, but HIS ANKLE IS CHAINED TO THE TABLE. The oth PRISONERS are LAUGHING and CHEERING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oi, Borden, get back here! Sullen FUMBLES with his keys as Borden takes a BOW. Anoth warder CRACKS Borden over the head with a TRUNCHEON. Sull now free, KICKS Borden in the ribs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON AN ADVERTISSIMENT: "the professor has DEFIED DEA to return with a new SPECTACULAR!" Pull wider-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A NEWSPAPER on the makeup table. Angier sits at the mirro He hubs BROWN PASTE into his hair and then combs it out. Then he chooses a beard, seats it on his chin and begins adjust it. He drops the BOTTLE of spirit gum as he looks the mirror and sees OLIVIA standing behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you'd gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olivia shifts. Embarrassed. 49.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't really.... have anywhere to go. Angier slips the newspaper from the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've been sleeping here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cutter said it would be okay till we get another booking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Researching. Part of a magician's job is to watch his competition, to see what illusions they're-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to do something to that man, aren't you? Olivia moves closer. Angier is quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cutter's hopig you'll let things life. He says if Borden thinks things are even between you then we can-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even? My wife for a couple of his fingers? He has a child now. And he's perfoming again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden is out there, living his life just as he always intended. As if nothing had happened. And look at me. I'm alone. And no theatre will touch me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Us. Olivia moves towards him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to need a better disguise. Olivia reaches for Angier's beard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier, almost unrecognizanle as a blonde, slips into the back of the theatre, which is as rough and unwelcoming as Borden's last venue. 50.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the small raised stage, Borden works through his way through the Chinese rings with GLOVED HANDS to hide his damaged fingers. The tough crowd is JEERING AT HIM. Borden puts the rings down on a table and PICKS UP a bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need a volunteer. Angier takes a few steps towards the stage. Borden produces a RUBBER BALL. he TOSSES the ball to Angier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As you can see , it's just a rubber ball. But it's not normal at all. Angier examines the ball. Hands it back to Borden who sho no sign of recognizing Angier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. Angier notices that two TALL BLACK CABINETS are standing twenty feet apart on the stage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not impressed? Borden BOUNCES the BALL on the ground and catches it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a magic ball. Borden continues to BOUNCE the ball on the floor. The audience looks bored, waiting for something to happen.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVIA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier still in disguise, is slumped in an armchair, drin in hand. He is SMILING, remembering. Olivia, sitting on the workbench, waits for him to contin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened, Robert?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He had a new trick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was it good? 51.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier looks at her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now it's CUTTER standing in the audience, watching. Onsta Borden BOUNCES the ball over and over again.

dialogues.speaker: ANGIER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: It was the greatest magic trick I have ever seen. Borden walks to one side of the stage and OPENS the door one of the cabinets. It's empty. He CLOSES it again and crosses the stage, BOUNCING the ball the whole way. At the far cabinet, Borden repeats the process, OPENING t door to the empty cabinet. This time, however, he leaves the door open. He steps forwards and GENTLY BOUNCES the ball SIDEWAYS, a the stage... Borden STEPS into the CABINET behind him, CLOSING the doo With no one on stage, the audience watches as the ball continues to BOUNCE across the stage. BOUNCE. BOUNCE. BOUNCE. The ball loses seep and height... Just as reaches the second cabinet, something IMPOSSIBLE happens.

dialogues.speaker: CATCHING THE BALL.
dialogues.text: Cutter FLINCHES, then studies Borden. The audience is BEMUSED. Finally, a trickle of applause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier is talking to Cutter. Olivia is watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did they applaud when you saw it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not very enthusiastically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier is disguise, starts CLAPPING loudly, FIRMLY, as if can't help it, LEADING the applause. Borden BOUNCES the ball once again, then BOWS deeply. The APPLAUSE peters out. Borden walks off the stage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier turns to Cutter. 52.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The trick is too good -- too simple- the audience harly knows what they've seen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a dreadful magician.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a wonderfull magician- he's a dreadful showman. He doesn't know how to dress it up, how to sell the trick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How does he do it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He uses a double.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not that simple. This is a complex illusion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think that because you don't know the method. It's a double who comes out at the end. It's the only way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've seen his perfom ir three times now, Mr. Cutter- the Prestige is the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same man comes out of the second cabinet. I promise you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is the same man. They both turn to look at Olivia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wears padded gloves to hide his damaged fingers, but if you look closely you can tell. Angier looks at Cutter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't know how to sell his trick to an audience. But I do. 53.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It would give us our climax.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man stole my life. I'm going to steal his trick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll have to find someone who can look like you on a stage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't use a double-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know how Borden does it, Robert. So either you wait for Borden to retire and buy his secret, or you can listen to how I would do this trick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ang the only way I know is to find you a bloody good double.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier smiles. Turns to Olivia, pointing to his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take a good look- let's get out there and find me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier, swinging his cane, walks slowly up the mountain r

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lab is illuminated by thirty fot STREAMERS of electri DISCHARGE that pour from the base of the tower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier stops, fearful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's perfectly safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Angier stares, a MAN begins to emerge from the very ce of the CONFLAGRATION.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bolts SNAP and TRAIL after the man as he walks, in SILHOU towards Angier. 54.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So this is the Great Danton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tesla emerges from the ball of electricity, dressed as if were on his way to the opera. He brushes SPARKS from the sleeve of his jacket as he extends a band to Angier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Alley has effused about your act to me on any number of occasions. Something you did with pockets?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier returns the handshake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw a lecture you gave in London, several years ago. I'm flattered you agreed to see me. Tesla keeps hold as Angier's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier, confused, does so. Alley hands him a lightbulb, which starts to glow as he grasps its metal base.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's conducting the electricity?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our bodies, Mr. Angier, are quite capable of conducting, and indeed, producing energy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tesla release Angier's hand. The bulb goes out. Alley tak it from the Angier who looks at the palms of his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you eaten, Mr. Angier?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier, Alley and Tesla are seated around a table on a de overlooking a spectacular view. They are eating sandwiche

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alley has explained that you require a very interesting device.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need something impossible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're familiar with a phrase 'Man's reach exceeds his grasp'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off his look) It's a lie. Man's grasp exceeds his nerve. The only limits on scientific progress are these imposed by society. Tesla looks out at the mountains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The first time I changed the world I was hailed as a visionary. The second time I was asked politely to retire. The world only tolerates one change at a time. And so here I am. (gestures at laboratory) Enjoying "retirement". (looking at Angier) Nothing is impossible, Mr. Angier. What you want is simply expensive. Tesla rises, washing his hands in a basin on a side table

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alley says you are a stage magician. If a built you this device, you would be presenting it only as an illusion?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If people thought the things I did on stage were real, they wouldn't clap- they'd scream. Think of saving a woman in half. Tesla nods. Considering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr.Angier, the cost of such a machine-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Price is not an object.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps not. But have you considered the cost?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm noit sure I follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can make your machine, Mr. Angier. But I can also give you some advice...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go home. Forget this thing. I can recognize an obsession. As Mr. Alley could tell you, I myself an given to one now and then. It will not do you any good. 56.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have your obsessions done you no good?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At first. But I've followed them too long- I am their slave. Their whipping boy. And one day they may choose to destroy me. Angier looks into Tesla's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: if you understand an obsession then you know you won't change my mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So be it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you build it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have already begun to build it, Mr. Angier. I hope you enjoy the mountain air. This will take time. Tesla disappears into the lab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The club is warm and dark. Olivia, Cutter and Angier make their way to the bar. Olivia points to the far end of the bar, to a TRAMP in tattered clothing, curled over a pint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gerry? The tramp sees Olivia, hoists himself up and spills his w down the bar to them. As he draws closer, we understand w Olivia has brought them here. Underneath the filth and matted hair, this man is SPITTIN IMAGE of Robert Angier- HE IS PLAYED BY THE SAME ACTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Angier, Mr. Cutter, I would like you to meet Mr. Gerald Root.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pleasure to meet you fine gentlemen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier is staring a little too much. Root throws an ARM over Angier's shoulder and draws him in. 57.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like for me to tell you a little joke?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier smiles unconfortably. Sunddely Root WRAPS this han around Angier's neck and begins to THROTTLE him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cutter breaks it up and pushes Root back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you laughing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier is shaken. Root picks up his hat off the bar and disappears onto the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's out of his mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's an out-of-work actor- of course he's out of his mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's perfect. A little work, mind you, but when I'm done with him he could be your brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't need him to be my brother. I need him to be me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden escorts Sarah and their TODDLER, a girl, up the th lined street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden stops abruptly. Crouches to his daugther.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like to see a magic trick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden reaches up and pushes a wayward LOCK a her hair ov her ear. When his hands returns, it's holding a KEY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stands, places the key in Sarah's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden takes her gently by the shoulders and turns her ar until she's facing a modest two-story HOUSE. She looks do at the key in her hand. 58.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I asked last week you said we couldn't afford.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You caught me in the wrong mood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you want through all the-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah, I'm allowed to change my mind, aren't I? The act is taking off, maybe soon I'll get us into a bigger theatre. Things will work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah turns and embraces her husband.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The auditoruim is empty. Two doors is simple frames have been erected in the middle of the stage. Angier fiddles with one, opening it, walking through it. Olivia is watch

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You walk through this one- then...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier stands Olivia in front of the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: he pushes the door all way open. Suddenly, a TRAP-DOOR se into the floor POPS open. Angier JUMPS through it-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olivia gathers up her skirts and DROPS through the hole-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -LANDING beside Angier on the straw matterss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oof. Couldn't you find a softer one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not for sleeping on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olivia looks around the below stage area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Root goes up through there? 59.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gestures at a LIFT twenty feet away with a TRAP DOOR MECHANISM above it. Angier nods. Olivia looks at Angier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's going to be amazing, Robert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It has to be. Borden's trick is getting noticed. The place was packed today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olivia looks at him strangely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You went and saw his show again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier looks away, embarrassed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You becoming obsessed, Robert.

dialogues.speaker: CUTTER, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Ready to meet yourself, Mr. Robert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier and Olivia look up to see Cutter at the trap door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier and Olivia sit in the front row. Cutter beckons Ro onstage. He's been clened up and dressed in Angier's stag costume. he TRIPS on his way across the stage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I have to do is keep myself stinking drunk all the time and no one will be able to tell the difference.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little faith, sir. Could you favor us with a perfomance. Mr. Root?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Root picks himself up and dusts himself off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, ROOT HAS BECOME ANGIER. he is channeling everyt from his facial expressions to his walk. Angier nods, starting to believe this might work. The illusion is PERF till he opens his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You would drink, too, if you know the world half so well as I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier hops up onto stage, examining Root from different angles. Root starts APING his every movement. Olivia star laughing. Angier is getting uncomfortable. 60.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you think you were unique, Mr. Angier? I have been Cassar. I have been Faust. How difficult could it possibly be to play 'The Great Danton?'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can go back to being yourself. Root. For free.. Root looks challengingly at both men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd rather be him, for now. I find it amusing. Root WAVES his hands across his chest, in the same manner that Angier does onstage. He produces a bottle of Gin fro thin air, and takes a long swallow and jumps down to Oliv

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Root has to keep a low profile-- anyone sees him the game's up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know how you do these things, Cutter. I'm not sure I want to know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you thought about what we should call the trick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No point being coy. Borden calls his trick 'The Transported Man'? Cutter nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The enormous MARQUEE of the Empire Theatre: 'The Great Danton perfoms THE NEW TRANSPORTED MAN' Beneath it, a CROWD. Fallon amongest them. STARING up at the sign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier is onstage, nearing the end of his show, SMILING BROADLY as he pulls dozens of FLOWERS from thin air and t them to the crowd. APPLAUSE fills the theatre.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DOORFRAMES are wheeld out on either side of the stage Angier approaches the edge of the stage to address the audience with a suddenly SOLEMN demeanor. 61.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ladies and gentlemen, much of what you've seen tonight can be termed illusions. Entertaining trifles of the sort you may have seen other magicians perform.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier puts on a TOP HAT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alas, I cannot claim this next feat as illusion. Watch carefully- you will see no trickery, for no trickery is being employed. Merely a techique familiar to certain citizens of the orient and various holy men of the Himalyas. Indeed, some of you may be familiar with this technique, but for those of you who aren't, do not be alarmed, what you are about to see is considered safe...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier gracefully TURNS and heads upstage to the right-ha door, opens it, SLAPS it to show that is sold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then strolls through crossing the stage-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -to the other door, which he opens, SLAPPING to show its solidity, then walking trough the frame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier removes his TOP HAT and THROWS it high into the ai It sails back down to him and he catches it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier THROWS the HAT again, even harder this time, and i disappears uo into the rafters. After a beat, it is clear it's not coming back down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LAUGHTER. Angier snaps his fingers and the hat is dropped back down to him. He catches it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier movies to the first door and THROWS HIS HAT in a H ARC across the stage. He OPENS the door- steps behind it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The second DOOR, FAR ACROSS THE STAGE, IMMEDIATELY opens ANGIER/ROOT EMERGES, REACHING UP TO CATCH THE HAT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOTH DOORS SLAMS SHUT behind him. He puts on the hat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The AUDIENCE ERUPTS- A STANDING OVATION, Fallon the only in his seat as Angier/Root takes his BOWS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier, hearing the MASSIVE APPLAUSE, climbs off the stra mattress, PEERING up through the cracks in the floorboard

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smiling, Angier turns to the unseen audience and BOWS. 62.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier, Olivia, and Cutter are CELEBRATING their sucess. Empty bottles of champagne line the makeup table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To our achivement. They drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The manager said he's never seen a reaction like it. Angier smiles, rueful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At least he got to see it. I spent the ovation hidden under the stage. No one cares about the man who disappears, the man who goes into the box. They care about the man who comes out the other side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I care about the man in the box. Angier turns to Olivia, raises his glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we could switch before the trick. That way I could be the Prestige and Root ends up below stage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The antecipation of the trick is everything- it needs your showmanship to built suspense. If Root opens his mouth, it's all over- he can't introduce the trick.

dialogues.speaker: ROOT, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: of course I can. I'm the Great Danton. They turn. Root is lying behind a trunk, still in costume

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Root, you bloody fool, get that costume and makeup off right now, anyone could walk in here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cutter is SLAPPING Root to his feet. He grabs his collar and turns to Angier and Olivia. 63.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulation, all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cutter DRAGS Root out. Olivia slides onto the makeup tabl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I suppose I should get more rest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Life is not full of these moments, Robbie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olivia pours him some more champagne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've worked hard for this, and we need to celebrate properly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier looks up at her with a gentle smile. She pulls him in closer and they KISS. She wraps her legs around him. They kiss again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier pulls back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is your wife?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier shakes his head, distracted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The trick isn't good enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olivia stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't you see the audience?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, they loved it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not as good as his trick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden's trick is nothing compared to ours. He doesn't have any style-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't have to spend the finale hiding under the stage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier rises, turning out of her embrace. 64.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to know how he does it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So that I can do it better. Angier turns to her. Looks her in the eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need you to go and work for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Work for him? Are you joking

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll be my spy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We just got our start and you want me to leave?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's how we advance. Angier moves to Olivia, placing his hands on her shoulder

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think of it, Olivia... we've got people excited about Cutter's version of the trick- imagine what we could do with the real illusion. We'll have the greatest magic act anyone's ever seen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He knows I work for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly why he'll want to hire you. He'll want my secrets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would he trust me? Angier thinks for a second. Then smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because you're going to tell him the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alley shows Angier in. Tesla is sitting, reading. 65.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must be curious to see what so much money had bought you, Mr. Angier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tesla RISES. Leads Angier to a back corner at the room an pulls a SHEET from a ten-foot tall apparatus- the ELECTRI MACHINE Angier used on stage in the opening of the film.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fitting that you should be here for the maiden voyage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alley FIRES a GENERATOR connected by thick cables to the machine. It RUMBLES into life, smoke pouring from the sla

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your hat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier takes off his hat and tries to hand it to Tesla. Alley intercepts the hat and lays it on a chalk hasmark directly underneath the machine. He returns to the contro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You might want to stand back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no. It will be fine. Mr. Alley, please proceed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without further ceremony, Alley FIRES the machine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing happens. Then, as they watch, the GLOBE on top of the tripped FLASHES whits hot. BOLTS shooting out of it, wrapping themselves around the legs of the tripod. The CH reaches a FREEZY and then emits a loud BANG, as if it has broken the sound barrier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly the room is still.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tesla walks forward. Looks down into the pit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alley joins him at the edge of the pit. Angier, limping, is the last to arrive, locking into the pit-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -at the TOP HAT, which hasn't moved an inch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tesla STARES at the hat as if trying to melt it with CONCENTRARION. Alley pulls Angier away from the pit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps it would be best if you left us to it. We'll see you next week?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier begins to protest but Alley gestures towards the d 66.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small, disused shop off an arcade, crowed with tools, cabinetry and props, windows plastered with playbills. Bo is sitting at a workbench, sleeves rolled up, working a l Fallon enters, Olivia behind him. Borden looks back at he turns back to the table, instinctively putting on his glo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Interesting workshop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We make do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name is Olivia Wenscombe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know who you are. Are you here to steal the rest of my show? Olivia sees one of the theatrical notices that litter the shop: "THE GREAT DANTON BREAKS RECORD WITH HIS ASTONISHIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I'm here to give your show what is missing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what might that be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wasn't I just saying that, Bernard? A woman's touch. Fallon leaves, closing the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've left Angier. I want a job. Borden sits there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you have no reason to trust

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why on earth shouldn't I trust you? The mistress of my enemy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olivia is taken aback. Chanes tack. 67.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr.Borden-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alfred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alfred. I'm going to tell you the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah. The truth. A slippery notion in our life of work, Miss Wenscombe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here because he sent me here. He wants me to come and work for you and steal your secret.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does he need my secret for? His trick is top notch. The Great Danton vanishes and isntantly reappears on the other side of the stage -- mute, overweight, and, unless I'm mistaken, rather drunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden rises, moves closer to Olivia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me, Olivia. Does he like taking his bows under the stage?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olivia meets his gaze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. It's killing him. he's obsessed with discovering your method. He thinks of nothing else, and takes no pleasure in our sucess. I've had enough. There's no future with him. He sent me here to steal your secrets, but I've actually come to offer you his.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has no secrets from me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden stares at her, unsure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And this is the truth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gives Borden a challenging smile/shrug. 68.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cutter is fixing a prop mechanism. Angier approaches, in his undershirt, looks over his shoulder. Cutter glances u

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Best be getting changed for the martinee, sir. - Angier nods. Cutter REALIZES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROOT! You're late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And even more drunk than usual. Get yourself below stairs, right away!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No?! Root looks at Cutter with genuine malice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need to have a chat, Mr.Cutter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier is applying his makeup. Cutter enters. Angier look at him through the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have a problem, Cutter. He holds up the paper, folded to an advertisement:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll be perfoming right across the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have a bigger problem. Root.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't tell me he fell over again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Worse. He realized he can make demands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's blackmailing us? 69.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a word, yes. I'm surprised, to be honest- it usually takes them a lot longer to figure it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much does he want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It makes no difference- we have to stop doing the trick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop doing the trick? Look at this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at yesterday's. And last week's, where they called you "London's premiere stage performer", not "magician" mind. Performer. Of any kind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the point?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My point, Robert, is that you've climbed too high to get away with any kind of professional embarrassament. We're not doing any tricks we can't control. Angier considers this. Nods. Thinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pay him whatever he wants, for now. We keep doing the trick till Borden opens, then we'll phase it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Root smokes a cigarette. PULL BACK to reveal he is standi on the LIFT beneath the stage... The trapdoor OPENS and Angier DROPS onto the straw mattre He looks over to see Root finishing his cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get up there!! Root smirks at Angier- TOSSES the cigarette and CATAPULTS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -onto the stage and STEPS/STUMBLES out from behind the do to LOUD APPLAUSE. 70.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Root has a SLOPPY GRIN as he STRUTS acroos the stage, mil the applause from every angle, blowing kisses, winking... loving it. He turns to Cutter in the wings. Blows him a kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cutter GLARES. Then TURNS to a stagehand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get it down!

dialogues.speaker: ANGIER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Cutter was always surprised how fast Root turned bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The stagehand starts LOWERING THE CURTAIN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier sits with Borden's dairy.

dialogues.speaker: ANGIER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: We paid him enough to keep him in beer- you wouldn't expect him to rock the boat. Today I learned Borden's view on the episode...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bar is dark and seedy, packed with an unpromising lot

dialogues.speaker: ANGIER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ...and his account suggests a reason.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Root is hanging precariously from his barstool, head loll towards his empty glass. He is in his own clothes, but cleaned up to look like Angier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A full PINT arrives in front of him. Root turns to face h benefactor- BORDEN. Root takes several large GULPS, stari at Borden. Suppresses a belch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To what do I owe the pleasure of this rather welcome pint of ale?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are the Great Danton, aren't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Root gestures silence, glancing around them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course I am. But don't advertise it- I'll be mobbed with fans. (grins at Borden) And who might you be? 71.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a humble admirer. And fellow practitioner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, very good. Root DOWNS the rest of his new pint, placing the empty gl in front of Borden with an emphatic THUNK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you insist. I'm not perfoming tonight. Well, only one show, and, to be frank, my people pretty much run things these days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could probably do it blindfolded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bloody good idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. A new pint arrives. Root sips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, there's something I might warn you about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it's your Transported Man illusion. Now, I'm noit claiming to know your method... but I had a similar trick in my act- and I used... (looks around,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...a double.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I see, very good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At first. Then it went bad. You se, I hadn't counted on the fact that once I incorporated this bloke into my act, he had complete power over me. 72.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Complete power, you say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weel, he was the secret, you see. And the more successful I became, the more outrageous his demands became. He practically backrupted me. In the end I had to stop performing the illusion completely. (looks at Root) You must be very careful about giving someone that power over you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Root looks at Borden. Drunken whells spinning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for the warning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier is almost all the way through his act.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...some of you may be familiar with this technique, but for those of you who aren't, do not be alarmed, what you are about to see is considered safe...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier takes his time, confident, MILKING IT. He throws h HAT into the air, catches it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier DROPS ten feet to the concrete floor. But there is NOTHING to break his fall-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He SMASHES painfully to the ground. CLUTCHING his leg in AGONY, he looks up and sees SOMEONE standing on the lift twenty feet away... BORDEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The first door slams shut. The audience turns their atten to second door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door remains closed. The HAT falls gently to the floo SILENCE, broken by a COUGH in the audience.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BORDEN bows to Angier- the LIFT ROCKETS BORDEN UP THROUGH THE STAGE FLOOR. 73.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The second door OPENS, and BORDEN steps through, looking around, CONFUSED, as if he doesn't know where he is. He looks back at the door, then picks up the HAT...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier looks at his leg- a nasty COMPOUND FRACTURE. As he chokes on pain he can hear LAUGHTER from the AUDIENCE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Borden mugs with the hat, trying it on and finding it small, something is LOWERED from the flies above:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGIER/ROOT, BOUND AND GAGGED, HANGS from a chain. A sign around his neck reads: "OPENING AT PANTAGE- THE PROFESSOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden looks up behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great Danton, I must apologize! I simply had too much magic for my stage at the Pantages!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Great Danton comes to rest three feet above the stage

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pardon my intrusion!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden places the top hat and ANGIER/ROOT at a JAUNTY ANG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THUNDEROUS APPLAUSE and LAUGHTER. Borden BOWS, hops down off the stage, and walks up the aisle, bowing, enjoying i all the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cutter crouches over Angier, fixing a LONG SPLINT to his broken leg. Behind them, Root still hangs above the stage groaning in protest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't see how Borden found him- I had him under wraps, I was careful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, he did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cutter helps Angier to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit, do you think it might be her? Olivia?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier stops to look at Cutter. 74.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cutter gestures at Root.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shall we cut him down?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's the Great Danton. Let him cut himself down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier, thinly disguised, leg in long metal brace, pushes through the crowd outside the box office. The marquee: Th Professor Performs His Masterpiece- THE ORIGINAL TRANSPOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the box office: SOLD OUT THRU SUNDAY. Angier STARES.

dialogues.speaker: SCALPER, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Need tickets, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier turns to the SCALPER. Nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier slumps into a seat at the back of the PACKED theat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ONSTAGE: Borden works through his show with a SUPERIOR DE OF SHOWMANSHIP, even cracking a smile when called for. Working WITHOUT GLOVES, he makes much of performing trick ONE-HANDED. He is assisted by Olivia, who looks STUNNING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden performs ths Transported Man. Borden HAS DRESSED I UP WITH ELECTRICAL APPARATUS. Two large glass balls trans SPARKS between one cabinet and the other along BARE WIRES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another watches, anger rising as he watches Olivia's clos RAPPORT with Borden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olivia enters in to the darkness bedroom. She strikes a match and lights one of the gaslights...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and SCREAMS as the gaslight illuminates Angier, sittin in an armchair, cane leaning against the arm of the chair

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You weren't expecting me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was expecting you sooner, Robbie. Your message said "afternoon". 75.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it takes a bit for me to get around these days...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier RAPS his leg brace with his cane. HOISTS himself u

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's taken everything from me. My wife, my career... now you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean? You sent me to-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier takes her by the shoulders, ROUGHLY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I sent you to steal his secret- not to improve his act-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's my job-!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or to fall in love with him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You abandoned me to him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier SLAPS her. She shakes her head at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did everything you asked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes? Then how does he do it?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cutter was right- it's a double.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier shakes his head, furious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course Borden said that-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He didn't say anything- he'd never say. I've seen things- make-up, glasses, wigs. We don't use any of it for the show, but I've found it hidden backstage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's misdirection- he leaves those things lying around to make you think he's using a double. 76.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the time? He doesn't know when

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the time, Olivia- that's who he is, that's what it takes- he lives his act, don't you see?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And just because you're sleeping with him doesn't mean he trusts you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olivia glares athim, tears forming in her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You thing you can see everything, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She moves to her bed, REACHING below the mattress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the Great Danton, is a blind fool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olivia tosses something at Angier: a CARDBOARD-BOUND NOTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His notebook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier starts leafing desperately through pages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You stole it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I borrowed it for tonight. I thought you'd be able to translate some of it, but now I realize-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olivia, no one could-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a cypher- with a transposition that probably shifts every day of the diary. Even with the keyword it would take months to decode...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And without the keyword? 77.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps never. We'll see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier puts the cardboard-bound notebook into his pocket. Olivia, worried, holds out her hand for the notebook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, we won't- if I don't get that back tomorrow morning, he'll know I took it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier looks at her, incredulous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can'r possibly think I'd let this go? This is his diary, Olivia. All of his secrets are right here, in my hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't do this do me, Robert!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He knows where I live!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to know his method.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It won't get your wife back, Robert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care about my wife- I care about his secret!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier stops, realizing what he said. Calms himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I'll go to his workshop and stage a break-in-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll know it was you-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier puts his hands GENTLY on her shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, me, not you. Understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olivia nods, crying. Still scared. Angier drags his leg t the door. She watches him go, torn. 78.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert? I have fallen in love with him. Angier looks at her, sympathetic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I know how hard this had been hard for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden and Fallon survey the WRECKAGE of their shop. Bord looks at Fallon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Notebook. Fallon nods. Borden sighs. Weary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then he's just getting started.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small CROWD of autograph SEEKERS crowd the stagedoor. A BODYGUARD steps through the door and begins unshering the away as Fallon and Borden follow him through the door. The bodyguard hold the door to a carriage open and Fallon steps up. Borden stops at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm walking tonight, gentlemen. Fallon looks concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let him come. I don't care. Borden doffs his hat and walks onto the crowd street. Fallon steps down, reaches into the bodyguard's jacket an pulls out a PISTOL. He checks that it's loaded and slips into his own jacket. Then he sets off after Borden.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. STREETS, WEST END
dialogues.text: Fallon continues to follow Borden at a distance. Borden steps into a tobacconist's. Fallon stops and idles at the street corner. As Fallon watches, acrooss the street, another man STOPS. Fallon slips back around the corner and looks:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Angier, leaning on his cane. 79.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden emerges from the tobacconist and continues down th street, a cloud of pipe smoke drifting after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fallon waits for Angier to set off after Borden, then fol both men from a distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden crosses to the same side of the street as Angier. Fallon picks up his pace and tries to cross the street bu is HELD UP for a second by passing traffi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he reaches the other side, Borden is gone, but he sees Angier dissappear down and alleyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fallon rounds the cornder and stops. The alleyway is EMPT he has lost them. Finally, he sees an open, darkned doorw towards the end of the alleyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fallon stops at the doorway, his gloved hand gripping te doorframe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier stands at the other end of the hallway, watching h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fallon takes a step towards him and CRASHES through the r floor to the basement below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fallon drops heavily into an almost-vertical OPEN COFFIN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DISORIENTED, Fallon just glimpses CUTTER DROP THE LID INT PLACE, shutting him in. Cutter starts NAILING it down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A GUNSHOT TEARS through the lid of the box. Cutter falls back, but is caught by Angier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier rolls Cutter off to one side. He is clutching at a BLOODY WOUND on his arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll live.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You save me the trouble to making you an air hole!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angie picks up the hammer and continues NAILING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden picks up his way through the overgrown cemetary. H hears a KNOCKING and turns:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier is behind him, RAPPING on a broken headstone with head of his cane. 80.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm impressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're finally getting your hands dirty. This is what a good trick costs, Angier. Risk. Sacrifice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sacrifice, I'm afraid, is all going to be yours. Unless you give me what I want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your secret.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden tries to gauge Angier's expression.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My secret?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your method for the Transported Man. Fallon wouldn't tell me. In fact, he doesn't talk at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have my notebook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Useless without the keyword.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier pulls a sheaf of writing paper and a pencil stub f his pocket. He offers them to Borden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Write down your method Mr. Borden. Describe it in full.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden takes the paper and pencil and stares Angier in th eye, gauging him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden writes a SINGLE WORD on the top page and folds it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want the method not the keyword- I don't even know if the secret is in you notebook. 81.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden looks at Angier with a glint in his eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The keyword is the method.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier reaches for the folded paper, which Borden lifts o of reach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is my ingeneur?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier pulls a SHOVEL free from a pile of dirt beside him He STAKES it into a fresh pile of dirt in front of Borden Borden looks at Angier, CONCERNED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier plucks the folded paper from Borden's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How fast can you gid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier movies away through the headstone, leaning heavily his cane. Borden begins to DIG.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cutter is slumped in a chair by the wall, his arm bandage He smiles up at Angier, who sits down next to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's the arm?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still attached. Did you get your answer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier holds up the folded paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our answer, Cutter. I haven't looked yet, I wanted you to share this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cutter looks curiously at Angier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I already know how he does it, Robert. The same way he always has, the same way we do. You just want it to be something more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier looks at Cutter, uneasy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, let's find out, shall we? 82.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier opens the piece of paper. A large GRIN spreads acr his face. he turns it to Cutter- it reads-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cutter frowns, confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does it mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It means, Cutter, that we have a journey ahead of us. To America.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cutter watches Angier's excitement. Awkward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert, listen to me. (gentle, but definite) Obssession is a young man's game, I can't follow you any farther in this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier looks at Cutter, uncomprehending. He considers say something. Stops. Restraining himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then the rest is up to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah sits by herself at a table for two. Borden ENTERS with a swagger, Olivia beside him, Fallon behind. The MAI D' hurries over, signaling WAITERS. Sarah looks up. UNCOMFORTABLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know we'd be joined for dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely. We're celebrating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Waiters spirit another table and chairs to join Sarah Borden pulls out a chair for Olivia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Wenscombe. Mr.Fallon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olivia smiles cheerfully. Fallon nods, embarrassed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to wine waiter) Champagne. Your finest

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are we celebrating, dear? 83.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we've hit upon a new trick, haven't we, Fallon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What trick, Freddy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, "Freddy". What trick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The WAITER presents a bottle of champagne. Borden nods without looking at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to bury myself alive. Every night. Then someone's going to come along and dig me up! OTHER DINERS are glancing over. The waiter uncorks the bo with a muffled POP and pours champagne into Borden's glas

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure my husband needs-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you to tell me what?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Awkward silence. Olivia shifts in her seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps, Mr.Fallon, you might escort Miss Wenscombe home. My husband's being a bore. I see no reason for the two of you to suffer as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fallon is on his feet, pulling back Olivia's chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good-night, Mrs.Borden. Good-night, Freddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They leave. Borden glares at his wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Freddy"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's my name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not at home. 84.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not always at home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah is clearly on the verge of tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alfred, why are you being like this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden, seeing her fistress, softnes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah, I had a terrible ordeal today. I thought I'd lost something very precious to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden looks at her speechless. Shrugs helplessly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see. More secrets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Secrets are my life, Sarah. Our life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah brushes away a tear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you're like this, Alfred, I'm not seeing the real you. You're treating me like your audience. Performing. I can't live with that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden just sits there. Offering nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier walks up to the hotel. A MOTORCAR is parked in fro and TWO MEN are unloading it. One of the men STARES at An as he enters the hotel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier walks to the reception desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought I had the place to myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unexpected guests. (looks out the window at the men) Not very polite. A lot of questions. At first I thought they might work for the government. 85.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Worse. They work for Thomas Edison.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier starts out the windo at the men unloading equipmen

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier sits at the desk, deciphering Borden's diary.

dialogues.speaker: BORDEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Today, a most curious development...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden turns to see Fallon show in Olivia.

dialogues.speaker: BORDEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: His assistent come to us with a proposition...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They start to speak as Borden's V.O. continues.

dialogues.speaker: BORDEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Obviously Angier has sent her, and told her to admit as much...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me Olivia. Does he like taking his bows under the stage?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olivia meets his gaze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. It's killing him. He's obssessed with discovering your method. he thinks of nothing else, and takes no pleasure in our success. I've had enough. There is no future with him. He sent me here to steal your secrets, but I've actually come to offer you his.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has no secrets from me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden stares at her, unsure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the "truth" you spoke of?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gives him a sly smile. 86.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. This is what he told me to tell you. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truth is that I loved him. And stood by him. And he sent me to you like he'd send a stagehand to pick up his shirts. (looks him in the eye) I hate him for that. They sit there in silence, appraising each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can spot Angier's methods from the back of the theatre. What could you possibly have to offer me? Olivia smiles, moves to Borden, reaching for his gloved h Borden flinches, surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You may know he does his tricks... but you can't understand why no one can see that yours are better. She tenderly PEELS OFF his padded glove revealing his mutiladed hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hide this. I had to look closely to spot it when you performed the Transported Man. (looks into his eyes) But this makes you unique... it shows the audience that you aren't using a double; You musn't hide it, you must display it proudly... (looks at hand) I'm sure it takes great skill to perform illusions with one good hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then let people know. You can be so much more then he is. I can show you how. Borden looks into her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: BORDEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I think she is telling the truth. 87.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden and Olivia are in bed together. It is raining outs He watching her get out of bed and moves to the window to smoke a cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: BORDEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I think we cannot trust her. But I love her. I need her. We need her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could he send you away? He must be blind, deaf and dumb. She smiles quietly at this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robbie's blinded by his jealosy. He'd do anything for you secret. Sending me away was the least of it. Borden considers this.

dialogues.speaker: BORDEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Trust is not the point- love is the point... who have we ever trusted? To open myself to such a relationship,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olivia makes her way past crowed MARKET STALLS.

dialogues.speaker: BORDEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ...to the dangers of such an affair... I need assurances of fidelity. Of love. Fallon is SHADOWING her from a distance.

dialogues.speaker: BORDEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: But how to be sure when truth is layered like the skin of an onion? I know a way... she must help me rid ourselves of Angier. It is the only way to kow her mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier looks up from Borden's diary. Pale. He flips pages and pages forward TO THE LAST ENTRY...

dialogues.speaker: BORDEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Today my mistress proves her truthfulness. Not to me, you understand. 88.

dialogues.speaker: BORDEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I have been convinced since she led me to Root... today, Olivia proves her love for me to you, Angier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier looks up from the notebook. Mind reeling.

dialogues.speaker: BORDEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Yes, Angier. She gave you this noteboook at my request. Yes, she led me to Root, and yes, Tesla is merely the key to my dairy, not to my trick. Did you really think I would part with my secret so easily after so much? Good-bye, Angier, may you find solace for your thwarted ambition back in yout American home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier STARES at the pages, unblinking. JUMPS to his feet

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier STRIDES up to the fence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier takes his cane and starts running its METAL TIP ac the eletrified fence- causing SPARKING and CRACKLING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alley emerges from the building, consufed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alley opens the door- Angier BURSTS IN past him, ENRAGED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've veen played for a fool!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who by?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tesla never made a machine like the one I asked for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We never said he had.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You let me believe that he had, Alley!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You stole my money because your funding was cut off- you've been shooting sparks at my top hat, laughing at me all along while you use my money to stave off ruin. I've seen Edison's men-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the hotel. I've every mind to bring them up here myself-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That would be unwise, Mr.Angier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tesla is holding a cage containing a large tabby CAT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is true, sir, that you are your one remaining financier. But we have not stolen your money...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, my cat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tesla silences Alley with a tiny GLANCE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I told you I could make your machine I spoke the simple truth. Science is just a name for the art of rendering the exotic mundane. It has no boundaries- its very purpose is to destroy boundaries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why isn't the machine working?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tesla gives Angier the slightest of smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because exact science, Mr.Angier, is not an exact science. The machine simply does not operate as expected. It needs continued examination.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did my top hat go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nowhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alley points to the top hat, which is sitting on a workbe 90.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've tried the damn thing a dozen times. And the hat went nowhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which is why we need to rey a different material. It may provoke a different result. Tesla opens the cage and points the open end at Alley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't expect me to handle the thing myself? Alley reluctantly reaches into the cage and pulls out the TERRIFIED CAT. He jumps down into the pit and secures the animal bu its collar to a eye-hook sunk into the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are responsible for whatever happens to this animal, Doctor. Alley pulls himself out of the pit, and Tesla CHARGES the generator. The cat stares up at the machine around it and HISSES. Without ceremony, Tesla FIRES the machine. As before, lar BOLTS spew from the head of the machine, down towards the unseen cat. The machine build to a DEAFENING ROAR, then sputters out. Silence. The three men begin edging towards the pit. Suddenly, a terrifying SCREECH. The cat is still there, still tied to the hook. Alley breathes a sigh of relief and starts to free the ca Tesla looks frustated. Suddenly, the cat bursts free of Alley and ROCJETS through the open side door of the lab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll go. Angier limps after the cat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier sees the cat disappearing along the edge of the building and into the forest beyond. Angier follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier pushes his way through the dense undergrowth, tryi to keep up, but the cat has disappeared. 91.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, kitty, kitty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, a HORRIBLE SCREECHING reaches Angier. He begins to follow the noise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stops at the opening of a tiny GLADE, no more than ten feet across.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two IDENTICAL CATS are fighting viciously in front of Ang He tries to separate the two animals, and succeeds in gra one. The other cat RACES off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier takes a few steps after it, then FREEZES, staring

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TOP HATS. Clustered in a small glads. The first cat slink its way through them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SECOND BLACK cat jumps from Angier's hands- RACES int the glade, HISSING, SPITTING, CHASING the first cat into

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier is left alone in the clearing, staring at the pile dozens of IDENTICAL TOP HATS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The top hats are in a pile on the dark. Tesla is at the table, measuring two HATS with a pair of Calipers. Angier and Alley are watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So the machine was working?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never bothered to check the calibration. The hat never moved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These things never quite work as you expect them to, Mr. Angier. That's one of the principal beauties of science.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tesla looks carefully at the hat in his hands. It has a tiny TEAR on the inside of the brim. He picks up another hat. It has the same TEAR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll need a couple of weeks to iron

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks at hats) -problems with the machine. I'll send word when it's ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier, still dazed, takes his cane and heads for the doo 92.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't forget your hat. Angier stops and looks at the pile of hats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which one is mine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are all your hat, Mr. Angier. Tesla smiles at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden's daughter, JESS, now four, runs into the room and tries to hop up into his lap. Laughing, he helps her up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are we going to the zoo this afternoon, daddy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy's got some business this afternoon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you promised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did I? Jess nods at him, solemly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then go to the zoo we shall. Borden holds the newspaper open for her to look at.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gestures to newspaper) Who's that? A large advertisement features a picture of Borden: The Professor- England's premiere magician!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's you, daddy? Borden picks up the girl off of his lap and stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy has some errands to run. I'll be back before you know it, so get ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden walks to the door. As he does, Sarah enters, avoid his eyes, then ducking him as he tries to kiss her. 93.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She reaches for the sherry decanter. He watches her pour. Sarah looks at him, eyes red from crying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We each have our vices. Borden moves to her, gentle concern in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah. Whatever you may think, your only competitions for my affections is my little girl. I love you. I will always love you, and you alone. She looks into his eyes. Fascinated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean it today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That makes it so much harder when you don't. She turns from him. Borden watches her sadly. Leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden walks along a disused strecth of industrial canal that snakes through the poorer neighborhoods of the city. Borden wanders into a tunel. Another man is waiting for him -- Fallon. Fallon hands Borden a folded piece of paper. He studies i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More shopping. She doesn't like the smell of money, doesn't she? Fallon looks away. Borden tears up the paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The little lady wants to visit the Zoo, I thought you could take her. I'll do it tomorrow, if not. (looks at his feet) Sarah... she knows. At least, she knows things aren't right. (looks at Fallon,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help me with her. Try and convince her that I love her. Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden, embarrassed, pats Fallon on the shoulder and make off down the path. Fallon sets off in the opposite direct 94.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olivia, barely wearing a dressing gown, answers the door Borden. She pulls him in, trying to draw him into a kiss, but he backs away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it. Freddy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please don't call me that. It's nothing, just... sometimes things seem... wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olivia looks at him. Cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freddy, I've told you before. When you're with me, you're with me. Leave your family at home where they belong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm trying, Olivia. Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get dressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden watches her move down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVIA, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: I saw Fallon hanging around my house again, after you left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olivia comes back in, half-dressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's something about him I don't trust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You trust me? (off her look) Then trust Fallon- he protects the things I care about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier walks out from the lobby. The two MEN he saw befor are loading up their automobile. Smiling, laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The coach pulls to a stop. Angier and the driver look up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A plume of SMOKE is rising from further up the hill. 95.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier rounds the bend in the road and comes into view of the laboratory. He FREEZES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fence has been TORN DOWN. Beyond it, the LAB has been BURNED TO THE GROUND. The metal tower is in SMOLDERING PIECES. Everything else is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier notices a piece of metal lying in the road near hi and, using his cane, flips it over. It's Alley's sign war trespassers to keep out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier takes down the picture of Julia from the mantel. H studies it a second then puts it in the top of his packed suitcase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BELLBOYS wrestle with Angier's cases as Angier walks the reception desk. The manager smiles up at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're sorry to see you go, Mr. Angier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier takes out his wallet and begins laying down bills.
