dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are sorry to see Mr. Tesla leave as well. He was very good to Colorado Springs. A very generous man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier smiles up at him, absently and begins to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Angier?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't feel it was necessary to tell the other men about the box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What box?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The manager smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier follows the manager down a darkened hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We never use these rooms in the off - season. It's a shame. 96.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The manager stops at a set of DOUBLE DOORS and unlocks th He pushes them open and ushers Angier through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier steps into the massive, elegant room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standing on the dance floor is an ENORMOUS SHIPPING CRATE Stencilled on one side "COLORADO SPRINGS"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier walks up to the huge crate, awestruck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An envelope addressed to him has been stuck to the front. Angier stops it and begins to read.

dialogues.speaker: TESLA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: My dear Angier, you will find what you were looking for in the box. I apologize for leaving without saying goodbye...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Under cover of night, a group of FIGURES ransack the laboratory.

dialogues.speaker: TESLA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: But I seem to have outstayed my welcome in Colorado.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The figure begin setting FIRE to the sides of the laborat

dialogues.speaker: TESLA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The extraordinary is not permitted in science and industry. Perhaps you'll have more luck in your field, mystified. As to the use of the machine...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The open crate sits empty at the side of a derelict stage Angier, in shirt sleeves is running cables to the MACHINE which is standing center stage.

dialogues.speaker: TESLA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Alley has written you a thorough set of instructions. I add only one suggestion on using the machine-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alley holds open the door to a coach. Tesla steps up into it and looks back from the coach's open door, up the moun 97.

dialogues.speaker: TESLA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: -Destroy it. Drop it to the bottom of the deepest ocean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: High on the mountain, the laboratory is ABLAZE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Such thing will only bring you misery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tesla folds himself into the coach, shutting the door as moes off down the mountain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier moves to one side of the stage where he makes a ha mark with a piece of chalk.

dialogues.speaker: ANGIER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Tesla's warning is as unheard as he knew it would be. Today I tested the machine...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He loads A GUN and places it next to the machine.

dialogues.speaker: ANGIER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Taking precautions in case Tesla hadn't ironed out the kinks in its operation...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier THROWS THE SWITCH. The machine GROANS into LIFE- SPARKING and GLOWING as it gets up to full power.

dialogues.speaker: ANGIER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ...if it went wrong I would not want to live like that for long...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier closes his eyes for an instant, listening to its p then THROWS HIMSELF INTO THE MACHINE. HE IS CONSUMED BY LIGHT...

dialogues.speaker: ANGIER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: But here, at the Turn, I must leave you, Borden...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The WHITS becomes handwriting an a page and we are-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden STARES at Angier's journal in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, you, Borden. Sitting there, in your cell, reading my diary. Awaiting your death. For my murder. 98.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden SLAMS the journal shut. Staring at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BORDEN stands at the fence again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lord Caldlow was happy to hear that you'd reconsidered his offer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier's journal, the "gesture of good faith"? It's a fake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I assure you it's not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It has to be- it refers to events that happened after his death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clever predictions, I'm sure. The provenance of the journal is clear and under no doubt. It's written in Angier own hand, of which we have numerous examples. (looks at Borden) What makes you think it's a fake?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden looks away, uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't matter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden leans forward and stuffs ROLLED PAPERS through the fence. Owens takes them carefully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My tricks. All of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Including the Transported Man? Lord Caldlow will be very pleased.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No he won't. They're not complete- you only have the Pledge and Turn for each.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Owens leafs through the papers, annoyed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without the Prestige for each trick these are wothless. 99.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll get the rest after you bring my daughter here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Owens looks at Borden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to say goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jess sits at the foot of the stairs, listening to her par SHOUT at each other in the living room. She is CRYING.

dialogues.speaker: BORDEN, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Stop it! Just stop it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deny it all you want- I know!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah is WILD, eyes red, hair a mess. Utterly DISTRAUGHT Borden is trying to calm her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah, it's not true! I've told you Olivia means nothing to me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll go yo her! I know what you really are, Alfred!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah. You can't do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jess looks up. Fallon is standing above her. Listening.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: I'll do what I have to!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jess reaches up a hand. Fallon takes it in his.

dialogues.speaker: BORDEN, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Sarah, you can't talk like this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah turn to face Borden. Deperate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't live like this! 100.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want from me! Sarah pauses. Catches her breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to be honest with me. No tricks, no lies, no secrets. Borden calms. Looks into her eyes. Nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you love me? Borden looks into her eyes. Sincere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not today. Sarah takes this in. Borden watches, helpless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. Borden watches her turn away from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jess reaches up to Fallon with her other hand. He takes h gently in his arms. We stay on Jess's tear-stained face over Fallon's shoulder as he carries her up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON A POSTER: Borden, in costume, looking intense: T PROFESSOR- MASTER OF DARK FORCES. As we PULL BACK we hear GENTLE CREAKING... PULL BACK past a hanging PAIR OF FEET, one shoe missing.. wider shows up that it is SARAH, HANGING BY HER NECK FROM BEAM IN THE MIDDLE OF THE SHOP. Gently swinging.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cutter is finishing his meal at the bar. He goes to take swig from his pint and FREEZES- at the bottom of the glas A PLAYING CARD. He looks around the bar. No one he recognizes. He reaches into the glass. Cutter pulls out the card- an ADDRESS is written up one s

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cutter walks along labyrinthine streets. Stops at an ABANDONED THEATRE. He looks up at the building, then ente 101.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cutter makes his way past the tattered box office and int the derelivt auditorium. In the middle of the room is the CRATE. Cutter stands and stares at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cutter turns. A STAGEHAND. His eyes are solid white. The man is clearly BLIND.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I- I'm looking for an old friend-

dialogues.speaker: ANGIER, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: I heard about a booking... Cutter turns. Angier is behind him, leaning on his cane. Beside Angier is a SECOND BLIND STAGEHAND.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice little theatre. Good up-and- coming magician.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You came back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a good to see you, John. Cutter sizes Angier up. Looks around the theatre.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good rehearsal space. Blind stagehands. I like it-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You always had an eye for publicity. Angier sits in one of the stalls. Cutter follows suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need your help, John. My last show. A limited engagement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your last show?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A wise man once told me that obsession was a young man's game. I'm almost done. One thing left... (points at crate) The real Transported Man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cutter stares at the crate. 102.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to design a show around it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: i don't want you backstage, I need you front of house, managing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cutter considers this. Uncertain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: i need you calling in any favours and connections you have left to get us the right booking for the run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What sort of booking are you after?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sort that Borden can't ignore. Cutter looks at Angier. Nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long, expensive CARRIEGE creeps out to a halt outside t abandoned theatre, and the confused driver pulls over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the address, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The carriage opens, an imposing man in his 50's steps out looks the place up and down, then heads inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man enters the auditoruim and stares downat the BRIGH LIT STAGE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cutter moves quickly up the aisle, hand outstretched.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr.Ackerman. It's an honor to see you again, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ackerman shakes Cutter's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you said you only wanted to show me one trick it piqued my interest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a very special trick. Mr.Ackerman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier has appeared. 103.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pleased to meet you, Mr. Ackerman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Likewise, I'm sure. Let's get on, shall we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (down to stage) Turn it on, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a moment, the machine SPARKS INTO LIFE. ELECTRIC BO CASCADE from the GLOBE and SPLASH on the stage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very pretty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier smiles at Cutter and head back down the stage. he STEPS himself into the machine and DISAPPEARS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The machine SPUTTERS out and is silent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it, Cutter? He simply disappears? That's not a trick. He has to come back. There has to be a-

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: -a Prestige?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ackerman begins to turn around- then STOPS-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ackerman is dumfounded. He looks back down at the stage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quiet, haunted) Pardon me. It's very rare to see... real magic. it's been many years since I've seen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anckerman steadies himself;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you interested in helping us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. But you'll have to dress it up a little. Disguise it. Give them enough reason to doubt it. 104.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merrit sits eating a sandwich. The door to his office ope and ACKERMAN strides in. Merrit STRUGGLES to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Ackerman. When they said...I didn't think you'd be here in person. Ackerman sits without being asked to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have an act for your venue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, of course, sir...But I'm afraid I'm booked. The Moscow Ballet. They're playing through next year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get rid of them. This is a magical act. An excellent one. I believe you booked his first engagement several years ago. The Great Danton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really want me to- Ackerman stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll do it. Of course. Ackerman picks up a pen and paper from Merrit's desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There will be one hundred performances. No more, no less. Five perfomances a week. No matinees, no weekends. Ackerman scribbles onto the paper and hands it to Merrit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that's what you'll be charging for each ticket. Good day. Ackerman sweeps out of the room, leaving Merrit dumbfound staring at the scrap of paper in his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olivia and Borden are seated across from each other, fini their meal. Olivia watches Borden eat. 105.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You haven't spopken about her, Freddy. Not once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be cruel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would I talk about her to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because she was part of your life and now she's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She wanted to meet me the day before she killed herself. Said she had something to tell me about you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was such a coward, I couldn't bring myself to face her. (looks at Borden) What would she have said, I wonder?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want the truth about me, Olivia? (she nods, wary) I never loved Sarah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You married her, had a child with

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Part of me loved her. But part of me didn't. The part that found you. The part that's sitting here now. I love you. That is the truth that matters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olivia tosses her napkin on her plate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could be sitting in some other restaurant talking to some other woman about me that way. It's unhuman to be so cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden watches her rise from the table. She looks at him. 106.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By the way, have you seen who's opened at the Pantages? (Borden shakes head) The Great Danton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After two years. And he has a new trick. They're saying it's the best that London's ever seen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden cannot hide his reaction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you could see the look on your face, Professor. You should go to him- you deserve each other. Olivia smiles at him and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden, in disguise, takes his seat halfway along the ais

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lights dim. Curtains RISE on a simple stage. Bare exc for a WATER-FILLED GLASS TANK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden STIFFENS in his seat, perplexed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier limps onto the stage. Addresses the audience.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ladies and gentlemen, my first trick of the evening is one that involves considerable risk. (removes his coat) Anyone in the audience who would be irrevocable damaged by seeing a man drown should leave now, for when I tell you that the young lady who taught performing it, you will understand the seriousness of the danger involved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden watches the hook descend from the flies. Rememberi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INSERT CUT: Borden STARES as Angier desperately BRUSHES t water from Julia's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier steps forward as another curtain is drawn up behin him, revealing TESLA'S MACHINE. 107.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In my travels I have seen the future, and it is a strange future indeed. The world is on the brink of new and terrifying possibilities. The audience RECOILS in terror as the MACHINE is STARTED BOLTS fly from it. SMOKE drift over the audience. Borden inches forward in his seat. Angier stands in front of the machine, silhouetted by the FRENZY of electricity behind him. He TOSSES his cane to his assistant and steps into the machine. The audience SCREAMS as large bolts BLAST from the machin and wrap themselves around ANGIER'S ARMS and legs. Borden is watching very carefully. Angier is almost impossible to see as the machine builds to a climax, but, just before it does; Borden catches a glimpse of ANGIER'S BODY FALLING THROUGH A TRAP DOOR. The machine sputters out. Angier has DISAPPEARED. The lig are dim. A FOLLOW SPOT FIRES into the BOXES, audience loo up with a gathering commotion- ANGIER IS STANDING ON THE RAIL OF THE ROYAL BOX, thirtyfe above stalls. He smiles down at the audience.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man's reach exceeds his IMAGINATION! The audience breaks into a MASSIVE STANDING OVATION.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fallon is at the workbench, staring at a sketch of Tesla' machine. Borden paces, AGITATED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why only 100 performances? Do his methods dictate it, or is it simply a publicity move? Borden walks back and stares at the sketch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifty yards in a second. And all I know is that he uses a trapdoor. What's going on under that stage?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The theatre is closed, and tree BLIND STAGEHANDS are wreastling a TARP-WRAPPED BOX onto a cart in the alleyway behind the theatre.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fallon is watching from the shadows. 108.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fallon shadows the cart as it slowly makes its way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fallon watches from further down in the alley as the Blin Stagehands unload the box onto a dolly and wheel it throu the stage door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves closer, then STOPS. Seeing something. CUTTER has emerged from a nearby doorway and slipped through the sta door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The blind stagehand wheel the tarp-covered box to two LAR METAL DOORS in the floor of the auditorium and start hook it up to a winch. The metal doors open with a metal HOWL. Cutter slips down the aisle. WATCHING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man turns precisely to Cutter, flasing his white eyes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Cutter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm looking for Angier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You found him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cutter turns. Angier approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you, John- I don't want you backstage on this one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are they doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Disposing of the Prestige materials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cutter looks down at the BLACK HOLE in the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's down there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier looks at him, serious. 109.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you really want to know? Cutter considers Angier's grave tone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps not. Cutter leaves by the stage door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden sits at his work bench. Fallon fiddles with his ho hat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They do this every night. After each performance? Fallon nods. Borden gets to his feet with a sigh. Turns t a POSTER on the wall- "The Great Danton Perform THE REAL

dialogues.speaker: TRANSPORTED MAN- 100 SHOWS ONLY"
dialogues.text: He studies the image of Angier. There is a small DEVIL looking over his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're done. (turns to Fallon) Let him have this trick. You're not to go back there. I don't need to know his secret. Leave him alone. Fallon puts on his hat with a shrug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A packed house. Many hands raised. Move in on a BEARDED MAN, his gloved hand tentatively rising into the air. IT BORDEN. A GLAMOROUS ASSISTANT beckons Borden from the aisle. He shuffles along his row towards her. Embarrassed. Borden and four other VOLUNTEERS follow the Assistant dow towards the stage... On which stands Angier, leaning on his cane, smiling. Loo over him is the large and complex ELECTRICAL MACHINE. Bor STARES at the machine as he mounts the stage. Borden, FASCINATED, and the other volunteers look over th vast machine. As Angier GESTURES theatrically at the vari features of the metal and glass apparatus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the Assistant leads the Volunteers to the side of the stage, Borden slips through the gas at the side of the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -looks around, disoriented, then darts for some stairs le below stage where he runs into a burly STAGEHAND.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd you think you're going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden pulls off his beard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm part of the act, you fool!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Stagehand raises his eyebrows and steps aside. Borden RACES down below the stage. Cutter approaches the Stageha

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier throws switches on his machine. As it GROANS into life, SPARKING and CRACKLING, Angier gares at it, forgett his audience. Entraced. Possessed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden fumbles through the darkned area, lit by flashes a sparks through gaps in the boards of the stage above. He GASPS as a flash illuminates a STAGEHAND with SOLID WHITE EYES sitting nearby. Borden waves a hand in front of the Stagehand's face. He is BLIND. Borden moves on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier, facing the audience, steps backwards into the mac He looks up at the electricity sparking just above him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden lights a MATCH. In front of him is a LARGE GLASS TANK FILLED WITH WATER, ITS LID PROPPED OPEN. Borden frow

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOLTS of electricity draw inwards, wrapping Angier in a b of LIGHTING which CRACKS-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ROOM fills with lIGHT as a TRAPDOOR snaps open and a BODY DROPS INTO THE TANK. The lid of the tank and trapdoo above SNAP SHUT, leaving the tank, and Borden, in complet DARKNESS. 111.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Machine sputters to a stop. Angier is GONE. The audie sits, WAITING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden the tank, ANGIER IS DROWING. His rolling EYES fixe on Borden, he POUNDS desperetely on the thick glass, SCRE BUBBLES...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden, HORROFIED, tries forcing the lif ot the tank open It's sealed shut. He leaves the tank and begins searching around under the stage. He finds a SPANNER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden SMASHES again and again at the glass of the tank, which spiders, then CRACKS, and finally GIVES WAY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WATER bursts from the tank, sweeping Angier's body into Borden, and both of them onto gournd. Above them we can hear YELLING. Borden rolls Angier onto his side and POUNDS on his back. Water and blood OOZE fro the man's lungs. His eyes are dilated and lifeless:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden is frozen, unable to move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cutter appears behind him, SHOCKED by what he sees. Borde turns to look at him, his eyes wild with confusion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MORTICIAN pulls back a sheet draped over a CORPSE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier's lifeless eyes stare up at us. Cutter looks at Angier, the up at the Mortician. Nods.

dialogues.speaker: JUDGE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Alfred Borden, you have been found guilty of the murder of Robert Angier...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: borden stands chained to the dock. The JUDGE has a piece black cloth draped over his wig.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will, in one month's time, be hanged by the neck until dead. May the Lord have mercy on your soul. 112.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A POLICEMAN shows Owens into the room, walking him past a of the equipment to the far end where Cutter stands stari at the MACHINE'S CRATE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr.Cutter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Owens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They shake hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you for coming, Mr.Owens. It's fallen to me to dispose of Mr.Angier's equipment. Looking at the manifest, it's cleat that Lord Caldlow has purchased the bulk of the items.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr.Cutter, if you needed to know where to deliver the items you surely could have just-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not just that, Mr.Owens. There is a particular item (turns to crate) This time, in fact, that I wish to... well, that is to say, I want to-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wnat to buy it instead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I suppose so, yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Owens moves closer to the crate. Sees the COLORADO SPRING stencil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the machine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid Lord Caldlow was adamant about procuring this particular item.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps if I dould talk to Lord Caldlow in person.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out of the question, I'm afraid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cutter nods. Owens starts to walk away. Turns. 113.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: of course, I suppose... if, in the course of your delivery arrangements your paths were to cross... I can't stop you from speaking your mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cutter nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden is sitting quietlt in a large cell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sullen opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still here, Borden?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got a visitor. Lord Caldlow. With a little girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden HURRIES to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden, clutching an envelope, is escorted across the yar PEERING at the fence. He catches a glimpse of this daught waling beside a man on the wooden section.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Borden reaches the fence he CROUCHES to greet his litt girl, forcing the Sullen and the other Warder to crouch t undo his chains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jess, how are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jess SMILES at him and reaches through the fence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've missed you. Fallon's missed you. We both have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden drinks in her gace, her hair. She grasps the fence

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I come in there, Daddy? 114.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything's going to be okay. It is only then that he notices the HAND ON HER SHOULDER. He rises to come face-to-face with Lord Caldlow-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must be Lord- -who is ROBERT ANGIER. Risen from the dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caldlow. Yes, I am. I always have been. Borden STARES at Angier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw you die. Angier just SMILES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They flatter you with all those chains, Alfred. Don't they know you can't escape without your little rubber ball? Borden says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I wanted to do was prove that I was the better magician. But you couldn't leave me alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were always afraid to get your hands dirty... (looks down at his

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Not anymore. And I win. Because no one cares about the man in the box, the man who disappears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You win. But don't take my little girl... Angier looks at Borden. Bitter

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know how hard it is to have someone so precious taken away, don't I

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden? But you can't take her with you know, can you? She'll be looked after. Good-bye, Professor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier gently pulls Jess back from the fence. She PROTEST Desperate, Borden holds out the envelope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait. Don't you want this? You paid for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your secret.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden nods. Angier steps up, takes the envelope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You always were the better magician, Borden. We both know that. HE TEARS the envelope in half. Then again. And again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But whatever your secret was, you'll have to agree-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tosses the peices on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -mine is better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier TURNS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier! Let me say good-bye. Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier stops. Lets Jess come to fence. She is crying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When are you taking me home, Daddy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soon. I promise. Soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For God's sake, Borden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy's coming, I promise. I promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden PRODUCES his RUBBER BALL. Jess looks at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I promise. 116.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden VANISHES the rubber ball. ANgier pulls Jess back from the fence and starts walking away. Borden rises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think this place can hold me, Angier?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier continues walking Jess away. Shaking this head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden is alone. He watches as the wind scatters the piec of his prestige over the muddy yard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier steps out of an ornate carriage with Jess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier steps inside with Jess. The HOUSEKEEPER comes to take her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come here, love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, there's gentleman waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier looks at her, surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cutter is in the drawing room, looking at the carriage cl on the mantle. Angier enters. Cutter spots his reflection

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dead God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Cutter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're Lord Caldlow. (Angier nods again) How?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I learned an American accent from-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are you alive, Robert?! I saw you on the slab, for God's sake. 117.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier fixes Cutter with a steady gaze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I magician never reveals his secrets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Housekeeper appears with Jess at her side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on, child.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier smiles kindly at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good night, Jess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's the girl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've seen her. I've seen her in court with Fallon...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cutter, realizing, looks at Angier, SHOCKED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What have you done?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She needs looking after-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She needs her father, but you're letting him hang. And I helped you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cutter moves to the door. In a daze. Pauses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I came here tonight to beg Lord Caldlow to let me destroy that machine. But I won't beg you for anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to. I'm going to make sure the machine. is never used again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A good magician never repeats his tricks. 118.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cutter considers this. Makes a decision.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, Lord Caldlow, where would like me to deliver it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My theatre. It belongs with the Prestige materials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cutter lookd at Angier. Sad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I once told you about the sailor who described drowing to me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said it was like going home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was lying. He said it was agony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cutter opens the door. Angier watches him go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden is at the fence. Fallon is on the other side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We go alone now- both of us. Only I don't have as far to go as you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden looks down at his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were right. I should've left him to his damned trick... I'm sorry. I'm sorry for so many things. For Sarah. I didn't want to hurt her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fallon wipes tears from his face. Borden looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't cry. Not for me. Go live your life in full. For both of us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden pulls the RUBBER BALL from his pocket and BOUNCES up and down. He TURNS to be led back into the prison, DROPPING the ball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ball bounces gently past the fence. Fallon catches it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden is led along the empty corridor, braced by six gua 119.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The procession stops at a large windowless metal door, su deep into the wall. Sullen opens the door and Borden is l inside. As Borden passes Sullen he leans in to his ear-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you watching closely? Sullen stares back at him, terrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is low and small. Two parallel beams, eight feet high, run from one wall to the other. Hanging from the ce of the beams is a chain. Below the chian is a trap door. Sullen locks the door to the chamber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jess is playing in the grounds. A NURSEMAID some distance off chats to a GARDENER. Jess looks up from playing. Someone is there. Cutter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CART pulls up to the side of the theatre. Cutter and two WORKMEN step down from the cart and move t the back of it. Cutter pulls the tarp off the back of the cart. Underneath it is the MACHINE's CRATE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crate is sitting on the dolly in the auditorium.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank-you gents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where do you want it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry. Someone's coming to help. The workmen levae. Cutter looks at the crate. Angier emerges from the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The warders remove Borden's chains and shackles and repla them with strong leather belts that bind his feet togethe and his hands to his sides.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They shuffle him forward onto the trapdoor. 120.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier and Cutter load the crate onto a platform suspende by a rope. Angier pulls open the two metal doors sunk int the floor. Cutter begins turning a WHICH, lowering the crate into th HOLE. Angier indicates a pile of bricks and a bag of sand

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm bringing this over after we're done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cautions as ever, Cutter. No one's going to use the place. I own it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier slowly climbs down a ladder from the hole to join Cutter in the darkness below. Cutter is standing next to the platform and the crate. Th only night comes from a LANTERN Angier is carrying. We ca see only a small flicker of the high moldy walls of the cellar, but it is a large open space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No room left- you couldn't have acommodated 100 performances.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a good thing I retired early then. Angier puts the lattern and his cane on the lif of the cr and the two men heft ir off the platform.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll put it down the end. Angier and Cutter move into the darkness with the crate. From the small pool of light afforded by the lattern, we see that they are navigating their way through a large sp filled with LARGE GLASS BOXES. They arrive at the end and set the crate down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll go mix the cement. Cutter looks at Angier, cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take a minute to consider your achiviement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cutter turns. 121.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cutter, I tried not to involve you. Cutter looks at Angier. Nods. Then disappears into darkne

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cutter comes across the stage and up through the auditori Fallon is coming in the other direction. As they pass they nod gravely at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden is held in place by the trapdoor by two warders. T HANGMAN walks up behind him and attaches a NOOSE to the c hanging above Borden. He slips the other end of the noose over Borden's neck. Positions it under Borden's jaw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier is alone bather in the lgiht of the lantern. He tu to the nearest glass box and smoothes a hand along its fa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one cares about the man in the box. Behind him, a NOISE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cutter? No responses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They WRDEN looks at Borden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alfred borden, on this day, in the name of the King and the high court of England, you will meet your end. Do you have anything to say for yourself. Borden saus nothing. The Warden gestures to the HANGMAn w begins to PULL the lever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abacadabra.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The trap DROPS from under Borden and he FALLS into the ro below. His rope SNAPS to a halt- 122.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier PEERS down the row of glass boxes with the lantern

dialogues.speaker: CUTTER
dialogues.text: Angier FREEZES. He can hear a small THUD, THUD, THUD gett closer, approaching from the darkness... Angier FLINCHES as a RUBBER BALL bounces into the light- Angier DROPS his cane to CATCH the ball. He turns it arou in his hands, confused. Light EXPLODES around him as a GUNSHOT rings out. Angier stands for a moment, confused, staring at the ball then COLLAPSES to the ground, clutching at his stomach. Fallon's BOWLER HAT breaks into the circle of light. he i holding a smoking pistol... Angier drops the ball and it rolls across the floor, comi to rest at Fallon's feet. But it is not Fallon's gloved hand that picks up the ball- -it is a MUTILATED HAND, WITH 2 1/2 FINGERS MISSING. Angi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You- you died. Borden shakes his head. Realization sweeps over Angier like a nightmare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A brother. A Twin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fallon DROPS into the coffin. As fallon stares up at us,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were Fallon. The whole time... Fallon/Borden's face disappears as Cutter seals his coffi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden smiles. 123.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were both Fallon. And we were both Borden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier considers this. Minds spinning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Were you the one who went into the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the ball bounces acroos the stage, Borden steps into t cabinet, shutting the door behind him.

dialogues.speaker: ANGIER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: -or the one who come back out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden steps out of the second cabinet and catches the ba

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A stagehand wheels the two stage cabinets into the dressi room and leaves. Borden holts the door after him.

dialogues.speaker: BORDEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: We took turns. The trick is where we would swap...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden opens the first cabinet and pulls up the false bot

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His TWIN BROTHER, in indentical stage clothes, uncurls hi from the hidden compartment and hauls himself out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fallon and Borden are seated at the makeup table. Fallon begins removing pieces of his costume and makeup and hand them to the other brother. As we watch, THEY SWITHC INDENTITIES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier stares up at Borden. Appalled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cutter knew. But I told him it was too simple. Too easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simple, maybe. But not easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both Bordens are standing at the workbench. One brother i gripping the other by his wrist and placing a CHISEL on h finger. 124.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He checks the placemen of the chisel against his own muti fingers, adjust the chisel's position, them picks up the hammer.

dialogues.speaker: BORDEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Nothing easy about two men sharing one life. The second brother SWIGS from a gin bottle, then BITES do a padded stick as the first brother BRINGS DOWN THE HAMME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden stares at his mutilated hand clasping the rubber b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Olivia? And your wife?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We each loved one of them. We each had half a full life. Enough for us, but not for them. Borden puts the ball in his pocket. Tears in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sacrifice, Robert- that's the price of a good trick. Borden looks down at Angier with contempt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you wouldn't know anything about that, would you? Angier is dying. He opens his mouth to talk, but his voic is so wak that Borden has to stoop to hear him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've made sacrificies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It takes nothing to steal someone else's work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It takes everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier stands in front of Tesla's machine. Loading the pistol. He places the pistol by the machine... Angier takes off his jacket and steps towards the HISSING machine. BOTLS curl themselves around him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This time we do not cut away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The machine sputters out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It didn't work.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Yes it did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier turns...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANOTHER ANGIER is standing on the chalk hashmark, STEAM r off his shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The first Angier lunges for the pistol and levels it at t second Angier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, wait! I'm the-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BANG! BANG! The firt Angier FIRES TWO SHOTS and, grim- faced, drops the pistol. SHOCKED. He stumbles back, in a daze, clothes still steaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier looks down, a slight smile on his face. He gesture to the lantern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want to see what it cost me? You didn't see where you are, did you? Let me show you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier slumps to the floor as he tries to reach for the lantern. He can't his hand to obey him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It took courage to climb into that machine every night...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A drowing tank, identical to the one we have already seen A blind stagehand sits behind it, smoking.

dialogues.speaker: ANGIER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Not knowing if I'd be the Prestige....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, a trap door flashes open as Angier falls from t stage door and SPLASHES into the tank. The lid snaps shut 126.

dialogues.speaker: ANGIER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Or the man in the box...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier pounds on the glass, frantic. The blind stagehand continues smoking. Oblivious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two hands SLAM shut on the lid of a birdcage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The blind stagehand are wrestling a LARGE CRATE onto a ca in the alleyway behind the theatre.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier stops trying tomove and leans back, resigned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You went halfway around the world. You spent a fortune. You did terrible things... and all of it for nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier looks up at him with his last spark of competitive

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing? You never understood, id you? Why we did this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The audience knows the truth- that the world is simple. Miserable. Solid all the way through. But if you could fool them, even for a second, you could make them wonder. Then you got to see something very special... (coughs, looks up) You really don't know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden just stares at Angier. Who smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was the look on their faced.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier's body TOPPLES over, KNOCKING over the lantern. Bo steps back as the oil spreads, flamming, fro the lantern.

dialogues.speaker: CUTTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Every magic trick consists of three parts, or acts...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden watches Angier for a moment, then turns to leave. 127.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The workshop from the opening of the film. We now recogni it as Borden's. Cutter performs the bird cage trick for t Little Girl we now know as Jess.

dialogues.speaker: CUTTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The first part is called the Pledge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cutter is showing far the canary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The burning lamp oil SPREADS LIGHT through the cellar...

dialogues.speaker: CUTTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The second part is called the Turn. I take the ordinary something...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier lies in his pooling blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angier's eyes move around, looking at the shapes around h increasing illuminated by the hellish light...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cutter WHIPS the shawl away- cage and bird have disappear

dialogues.speaker: CUTTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: But you wouldn't clap yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jess stares, EXPECTANT. Cutter hols up his handkerchief- covered hand...

dialogues.speaker: CUTTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Because making something disappear isn't enough...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cutter whips the handkerchief from his hand, revealing a canary. Just then, Jess SEES something and JUMPS off the chest, running past him...

dialogues.speaker: CUTTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: You have to bring it back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BORDEN IS IN THE DOORWAY- JESS LEAPS INTO HIS ARMS. Borde holds her tight. Looks at Cutter, who is putting on his coat. Nods. Cutter leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden reaches into his pocket and hand Jess his rubber b She smiles, then buries her head in his neck. 128.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden STOPS at the ladder. He notices the shadows from t burning oil playing on the walls...

dialogues.speaker: CUTTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Now you're looking for the secret...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden turns slowly to look back into the cellar, PEERING into the flickering light of the burning lamp oil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you won't find it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borden stares back into the cellar. What he sees puts a look on his face that is beyond words:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...because you don't really want to know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cutter spreads MORTAT on the last BRICK of the wall he ha built in the opening to the cellar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He places the brick in the wall, sealing it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cat slinks its way through a pile of top harts, knockin one over as it disappears into the forest beyond.

dialogues.speaker: CUTTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ...you want to be fooled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are left alone in the glade, staring at the top hats-
